Emily’s story
Emily
Emily
Esi menɔ sekɛndrisuku la, blanuiléledɔ dze tɔnye dzi.
When I was in high school, my dad had his first bout with depression.
Dɔlélea wɔe be tɔnye trɔ zu ame bubu kura.
It was as if my old dad disappeared and a new man took his place.
Tso ɣemaɣi la, blanuiléle si gbɔ eme, vɔvɔ̃ madzemadzee kple dzimaɖitsitsi atraɖii ɖe kpe na tɔnye.
Since that time, my dad has been plagued with sadness, irrational fears, and anxiety attacks.
Ele avu wɔm kplii ƒe 15 sɔŋue nye esia.
He has been dealing with this for 15 years now.
Etena ɖe edzi ŋutɔ be yeléa blanui nenema gbegbe evɔ enya be naneke medzɔ si ta yealé blanui nenema hafi o.
How painful it must be for him to be overwhelmed with sadness, even though he knows there is absolutely no logical reason to feel that way!
Yehowa Ðasefowoe míenye eye míaƒe hamea me tɔwo kpena ɖe mía ŋu ŋutɔ.
We are Jehovah’s Witnesses, and the congregation we associate with has been very supportive.
Míaƒe haxɔsetɔwo nyoa dɔme hesea nu gɔme na mí ale gbegbe, eye ame aɖeke mena tɔnye se le eɖokui me be yeƒe wɔƒe aɖeke megale hamea me o.
Our fellow believers have been so kind and understanding, and no one has ever made my dad feel that he isn’t useful to the congregation.
Ale si tɔnye le dzi dom le eƒe nɔnɔmea me na be meva lɔ̃e vevie wu tsã.
Seeing how my dad is enduring this trial makes me love him more deeply than ever.
Edzroam vevie be tɔnye naganɔ abe ale si wònɔ tsã ene​ enɔ lãmesẽ nyui me, metsia dzimaɖi ɖe naneke ŋu o, eye wònɔ dzidzɔ kpɔm.
I miss my old dad​ the one who wasn’t overwhelmed with anxiety, who didn’t suffer, who was happy.
Fifia etena ɖe dzinye ŋutɔ be ele be wòanɔ avu wɔm kple seselelãme manyomanyo siwo le abe futɔ makpɔmakpɔ aɖe ene gbe sia gbe.
I feel horrible that he has to battle daily with an unseen enemy inside his own mind.
Ke hã, tɔnye kua kutri vevie be yealé dzi ɖe ƒo ɣesiaɣi.
Nevertheless, my dad works very hard to maintain a good outlook.
Nyitsɔ laa esi eƒe dɔa gaho nɛ vevie la, edzea agbagba be yeazã ɣeyiɣi vi aɖe atsɔ axlẽ Biblia gbe sia gbe, ne anye kpukpui ʋɛ aɖewo koe hã.
During one recent dark period, he made it a point to read a little bit of the Bible each day, even if it was just a few verses.
Esia do ŋusẽe ŋutɔ.
That strengthened him greatly.
Biblia ƒe akpa sue aɖe xexlẽ gbe sia gbe nenema xɔe ɖe agbe.
Even such a seemingly small routine was a lifesaver.
Mekpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe tɔnye ŋu ɣemaɣi wu ɣeyiɣi bubu ɖe sia ɖe.
I was never prouder of my father than during that dark time.
Emily kple tɔa le nu ɖum ɖekae
Emily and her father enjoy a snack together
Nya siwo le Nehemiya 8:10 doa dzidzɔ nam ale gbegbe, afi ma gblɔ be: "Dzidzɔ si tsoa Yehowa gbɔe nye miaƒe mɔ́ sesẽ. "
I really like the scripture at Nehemiah 8:​10, which says: "The joy of Jehovah is your stronghold. "
Nyateƒe matrɔmatrɔe wònye.
That’s so true.
Dzidzɔ si mekpɔna le nɔviwo dome ne mede kpekpeawo hele gome kpɔm le wo me la daa gbe le nye dzi si xɔ abi la ŋu.
The joy I feel when I am in the middle of the congregation, participating and being fully active, helps fill my heart when there are holes in it.
Enana agbe ɖoa menye ŋkeke bliboa katã.
It gives me a warm glow that I can feel for the whole day.
Tɔnye ƒe kpɔɖeŋu nyuia na mesrɔ̃e be nɔnɔme sesẽ ka ke mee mato o, Yehowa le klalo ɣesiaɣi be yeakpe ɖe ŋunye.
My dad’s example has taught me that no matter what battle you face, Jehovah will always be there to support you.
Bu nya sia ŋu: Aleke Emily kpe ɖe tɔa ŋu esi wòdze dɔ vevie?
To think about: How has Emily supported her dad through his illness?
Ne ame aɖe le blanuiléledɔ lém la, aleke nàte ŋu akpe ɖe eŋu?
How can you help someone who is suffering from depression?
Ne Wò Ame Vevi Aɖe Ðo Kudo Nu
When a Loved One Is Terminally Ill
DOREEN ƒe nu ku esi wòse be wokpɔ nutete vɔ̃ɖi aɖe le yesrɔ̃ Wesley, si xɔ ƒe 54 pɛ ko la ƒe tago me.
DOREEN was shocked when her husband, Wesley, only 54 years of age, was diagnosed with an acutely aggressive brain tumor.
Ðɔktawo gblɔ be dzinu ʋɛ aɖewo koe wòanɔ agbe.
Doctors gave him only a few months to live.
Doreen gblɔ be: "Nyemexɔe se o.
"I couldn’t believe what I was hearing, " she recalls.
Melulu kwasiɖa geɖe.
"I was totally numb for weeks.
Ðeko wòdze abe menye mía dzie wòle dzɔdzɔm ɖo o, ke boŋ ame bubu aɖe dzie wònɔ dzɔdzɔm ɖo ene.
It felt as if it were happening to someone else, not to us.
Nyemenɔ mɔ kpɔm nɛ kura o. "
I was not prepared. "
Nublanuitɔe la, menye Doreen koe le nɔnɔme sia me o.
Sadly, Doreen’s reaction is not uncommon.
Mía dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ate ŋu alé dɔ aɖo kudo nu.
A terminal disease can afflict anyone at any time.
Gake dzidzɔtɔea, ame geɖe lɔna faa be yewoalé be na yewoƒe ame vevi aɖe si ŋu wokpɔ dɔlémafɔe le.
Commendably, many willingly take on the task of caring for a loved one who is diagnosed with a terminal illness.
Ke hã, dɔ sesẽ aɖee dɔnɔ dzi kpɔkpɔ nye.
Yet, caregiving is a formidable challenge.
Nu kae ƒometɔwo ate ŋu awɔ atsɔ alé be na woƒe ame vevi si le dɔ lém ɖo kudo nu eye woafa akɔ nɛ?
What can family members do to comfort and care for their terminally ill loved one?
Aleke ame siwo le be lém na dɔnɔa awɔ anɔ te ɖe woƒe seselelãmewo nu le amea ƒe dɔléɣia katã?
How can caregivers cope with the range of emotions they may experience throughout the course of the illness?
Ne dɔnɔa ƒe kuɣi ɖo la, nu kae woate ŋu anɔ mɔ kpɔm na?
As death approaches, what can be expected?
Gake gbãa, na míaƒo nu tso nu si ta beléle na ame aɖe si le dɔ lém ɖo kudo nu nye nu sesẽ egbea ŋu.
First, though, let us consider why caring for the terminally ill is a unique challenge today.
KUXI AÐE SI LI EGBEA
A MODERN DILEMMA
Kɔdzitikewo wɔe be amewo megakuna kaba abe tsã ene o.
Medical science has changed the nature of dying.
Anɔ abe ƒe alafa ɖeka ene va yi la, amewo ƒe agbenɔƒewo nɔ kpuie le dukɔ deŋgɔwo gɔ̃ hã me.
A century or so ago, even in more developed lands, the average life span was much shorter.
Ɣemaɣia, dɔxɔleameŋuwo kple afɔkuwo tsoa amewo ƒe agbe dzi.
People died quickly from infectious diseases or accidents.
Kɔdziwo mebɔ o, eye dɔnɔ geɖe siwo gbɔ wokpɔna le aƒe me la kuna.
Access to hospitals was limited, and most people were cared for by their families and died at home.
Egbea, woyi ŋgɔ le atikewɔnyawo me si na be ɖɔktawo tea ŋu léa dɔléle sesẽwo gɔ̃ hã nu ale be amewo ganɔa agbe vie.
Today, medical advances have enabled physicians to fight illness aggressively in order to prolong life.
Dɔléle siwo tea ŋu wua amewo tsã la megawua ame kaba nenema gbegbe le ŋkeke siawo me o.
Diseases that would have ended a person’s life quickly in times past may now stretch out over many years.
Ke hã, ne amewo le agbe vie gɔ̃ hã la, mefia be wohaya keŋkeŋ o.
However, this extended life may not represent a cure.
Zi geɖea dɔnɔawo tsia teƒe ɖeka eye wozua wɔnamanɔŋutɔwo.
Patients often have severe infirmities that render them incapable of caring for themselves.
Dɔnɔ siawo tɔgbi dzi kpɔkpɔ va zu taɖui eye wònye dɔ sesẽ.
Caring for such individuals has become much more complicated and demanding.
Dɔnɔ akpa gãtɔ kuna ɖe kɔdzi, menye le aƒe me o.
Consequently, more and more, death has moved from the home to the hospital.
Ame geɖe menya ale si tututu ame kunae o, eye ame ʋɛ aɖewo koe kpɔ eteƒe ame ku kpɔ.
Most people today are unfamiliar with the dying process, and few have ever actually witnessed someone dying.
Eya ta esi ame geɖe menya nu si ava dzɔ o taa, ɖewohĩ ana womatsɔ dzo ɖe beléle na ƒometɔ aɖe si le dɔ lém ŋu o.
Fear of the unknown, then, may hinder or even paralyze a person’s efforts to care for an ill family member.
Nu kae ate ŋu akpe ɖe ame ŋu?
What can help?
WƆ ÐOÐO DO ŊGƆ
PLAN IN ADVANCE
Abe Doreen enea, ame geɖe tɔtɔna ne wokpɔ dɔmavɔleameŋu aɖe le woƒe ƒometɔ aɖe ŋu.
As illustrated in the case of Doreen, many people feel devastated when a loved one is diagnosed with a fatal illness.
Ne ètsi mavomavo, vɔvɔ̃ ɖo wò eye nèle nu xam la, nu kae ate ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nàkpɔ mɔ na nu si le ŋgɔ?
Amid intense anxiety, fear, and grief, what can help you to prepare for the road ahead?
Mawu subɔla wɔnuteƒe aɖe do gbe ɖa be: "Fia ale si míaxlẽ míaƒe ŋkekewoe la mí, ne dzi nyanu nasu mía si. "
A faithful servant of God prayed: "Teach us how to count our days so that we may acquire a heart of wisdom. "
(Psalmo 90:12) Eya ta do gbe ɖa tso dzi me na Yehowa Mawu be wòafia ale si ‘nàxlẽ wò ŋkekewo’ nyuie la wò ale be nàte ŋu azã ŋkeke susɔeawo atsɔ alé be na wò ame vevia.
(Psalm 90:12) Yes, pray earnestly for Jehovah God to show you how to ‘count your days’ wisely so that you can use the remaining days with your loved one in the best possible way.
Esia bia be miawɔ ɖoɖo nyui.
This takes good planning.
Ne wò ame vevia ate ŋu aƒo nu eye wòlɔ̃ be miaɖo dze tso nyaa ŋu la, anyo be nàbiae be ame kae wòadi be wòatso nya me na ye ne eva dzɔ be magate ŋu aƒo nu o.
If your loved one is still able to communicate and is willing to address the matter, it may be wise to ask him who should make decisions for him when he is no longer able to do so.

Ne mieɖo dze tso nuwo abe nu si wòadi be woawɔ na ye ne yemegate ŋu le gbɔgbɔm o, ne adi be yeatsi kɔdzi alo woanɔ atike aɖe koŋ wɔm na ye ŋu la, esia ate ŋu aɖe nugɔmemasemase kple fɔbubu ƒometɔ siwo va tso nya me mlɔeba dzi akpɔtɔ.

Frank discussion about whether he wishes to be resuscitated, hospitalized, or submitted to certain treatments can minimize misunderstandings and feelings of guilt on the part of family members who are forced to make decisions for an incapacitated patient.
Ne mieɖo dze tso nyawo ŋu faa kaba la, ana ƒomea ƒe susu nanɔ nu si woawɔ be woalé be na dɔnɔa nyuie wu la ŋu.
Early and open communication allows the family to focus on providing care during the illness.
Biblia gblɔ be: "Afi si adaŋudede mele o la, tameɖoɖowo tsia akpo dzi. "
"Plans fail when there is no consultation, " says the Bible.
Lododowo 15:22.
Proverbs 15:22.
KPEKPEÐEŊU SI NÀTE ŊU ANA
HOW TO ASSIST
Zi geɖe la, nu vevitɔ si wòle be dɔnɔdzikpɔla nawɔe nye be wòanɔ dzi dem ƒo na dɔnɔa.
Usually, the caretaker’s primary role is to provide comfort.
Ele be woana ame si ɖo kudo nu la nanya be wolɔ̃ ye eye be yemetsi asi o.
A dying person needs to be reassured that he is loved and not alone.
Aleke nàwɔ esiae?
How can this be done?
Dzi ha aɖe alo nàxle agbalẽ aɖe si doa dzidzɔ na dɔnɔa si ade dzi ƒo nɛ la nɛ.
Read or sing to the patient, choosing literature and songs that are upbuilding and enjoyable to him.
Efaa akɔ na dɔnɔ geɖe ne woƒe ƒometɔ aɖe lé woƒe asi eye woƒo nu na wo blewuu.
Many people are comforted when a family member holds their hand and speaks softly to them.
Anyo be nàƒo nu tso ame sia ame si va be yeava kpɔe ɖa la ŋu nɛ.
It is often helpful to identify any visitors.
Numekuku aɖe gblɔ be: "Lãmesidzenu atɔ̃awo dometɔ mamlɛtɔ si megawɔa dɔ o ye nye toa.
One report states: "Hearing is said to be the last of the five senses to be lost.
Togbɔ be adze abe [dɔnɔa] le alɔ̃me hãa, toa ya agate ŋu ase nu kokoko, eya ta mègagblɔ nya aɖe si màgblɔ le amea ŋkume o la gbeɖe o. "
Hearing may still remain very acute although the [patients] may seem asleep so do not say anything in their presence you would not say to them when awake. "
Ne anya wɔ la, mido gbe ɖa ɖekae.
If possible, pray together.
Biblia gblɔ be, gbe ɖeka apostolo Paulo kple eƒe zɔhɛwo ɖo nɔnɔme sesẽ aɖe me eye womenya nu si ava dzɔ ɖe wo dzi o.
The Bible relates that on one occasion, the apostle Paul and his companions were under extreme pressure and were very uncertain even of their lives.
Nu kae kpe ɖe wo ŋu?
What assistance did they seek?
Paulo ɖe kuku na exɔlɔ̃wo be: "Miawo hã miate ŋu akpe ɖe mía ŋu aƒo koko ɖe mía ta. " (2 Korintotɔwo 1:8-11) Ne dɔléle sesẽ aɖe na nu te ɖe mía dzi vevie eye míedo gbe ɖa tso dzi me la, eɖea vi.
Paul entreated his friends: "You also can help us by your supplication for us. " (2 Corinthians 1:8-11) A heartfelt prayer during extreme stress and serious illness is invaluable.
LƆ̃ ÐE ALE SI NƆNƆMEAWO LE DZI
ACKNOWLEDGE THE REALITY
Ne ènya be yeƒe ame vevi aɖe ɖo kudo nu la, dzigbãnya gã aɖee wònye.
The very notion of a loved one dying is often distressing.
Nyateƒee, ku mele dzɔdzɔme nu o.
No wonder, for death is unnatural.
Womewɔ mí be ku nanɔ mía wum o.
We were not designed to accept death as a normal part of life.
(Romatɔwo 5:12) Mewɔ nuku o be Mawu ƒe Nyaa yɔ ku be enye "futɔ. " (1 Korintotɔwo 15:26) Eya ta ne mímedi be míabu ku ɖe míaƒe ame vevi aɖe ŋu o la, esɔ.
(Romans 5:12) God’s Word thus calls death an "enemy. " (1 Corinthians 15:26) So a reluctance to think about the death of a loved one is understandable, even normal.
Ke hã, mɔkpɔkpɔ na nu si ate ŋu adzɔ akpe ɖe ƒometɔwo ŋu be woaɖu vɔvɔ̃ dzi, eye woatsɔ susu aɖo nu si woawɔ be woƒe dzi nadze eme la ŋu.
Nevertheless, anticipating what may occur can help family members to ease their fears and focus on making things as comfortable as possible.
Woƒo nu tso nu siwo ate ŋu adzɔ dometɔ aɖewo ŋu le aɖaka si nye " Agbemeŋkeke Mamlɛawo " me.
Some of the events that may take place are listed in the box " The Final Weeks of Life. "
Le nyateƒe mea, menye dɔnɔwo katãe toa nɔnɔme siawo me o, eye menye ɖoɖo sia tututu nue wodzɔna ɖo hã o.
Of course, not all these conditions occur in every patient, nor do they necessarily occur in the same order.
Gake ne mede ɖeke oa, dɔnɔ geɖe toa nɔnɔme siawo dometɔ aɖewo me.
Still, most patients experience at least some of these changes.
Le wò ame vevi aɖe ƒe ku megbe la, anyo be nàte ɖe xɔ̃wò vevi aɖe si gblɔ va yi be yealɔ̃ akpe ɖe ŋuwò la ŋu.
After the death of a loved one, it may be wise to contact a close friend who has previously agreed to help.
Ele be dɔnɔdzikpɔlawo kple ƒometɔwo nalɔ̃ ɖe edzi be yewoƒe ame vevia ƒe fukpekpewo wu enu, eye megale veve sem o.
Caregivers and family may need to be assured that their dear one’s trial is over and that he is no longer suffering.
Mía Wɔla lɔlɔ̃a ka ɖe edzi na mí be "kukuawo meganya naneke kura o. "
The Creator of humankind lovingly assures us that "the dead know nothing at all. "
Nyagblɔla 9:5.
Ecclesiastes 9:5.
KPEKPEÐEŊUNALA GÃTƆ
THE ULTIMATE CAREGIVER
Nyɔnu aɖe va srã dɔnɔ aɖe si ɖo kudo nu la kpɔ le kɔdzi
A woman visits a terminally ill person in the hospital
Mele be míagbe ame aɖeke ƒe kpekpeɖeŋu o
We can learn not to turn anyone’s help away
Ŋuɖoɖo ɖe Mawu ŋu le vevie, menye le míaƒe ame vevia ƒe dɔléɣia ko o, ke le nuxaɣi siwo akplɔ eƒe kua ɖo hã me.
Relying upon God is essential not only during the terminal illness of a family member but also during the grief that comes following death.
Mawu ato amewo ƒe nyagbɔgblɔwo kple nuwɔnawo dzi akpe ɖe mía ŋu.
He may assist you through the helpful words and deeds of others.
Doreen gblɔ be: "Nyemegbea ame aɖeke ƒe kpekpeɖeŋu o.
"I learned not to turn anyone’s help away, " says Doreen.
Nyateƒeae nye be, kpekpeɖeŋu si amewo na mí la, wu gbɔgblɔ.
"In fact, the volume of help we received overwhelmed us.
Nyemaŋlɔe be akpɔ o.
I will never forget it. "
Yehowa Mawue nye Kpekpeɖeŋunala gãtɔ nyateƒe.
Yes, Jehovah God is the ultimate Caregiver.
Esi wònye mía Wɔla taa, enya míaƒe vevesesewo kple nuxaxawo.
As our Maker, he understands our pain and sorrow.
Ate ŋui, eye wòdi vevie be yeana kpekpeɖeŋu si míehiã be míanɔ te ɖe nɔnɔmea nu la mí eye yeade dzi ƒo na mí.
He is able and eager to provide the necessary help and encouragement so that we can cope.
Gawua, edo ŋugbe be eteƒe madidi o, yeaɖe ku ɖa kura, eye yeafɔ ame biliɔn geɖe siwo le yeƒe susu me la ɖe tsitre.
Better yet, he has promised that he will soon eradicate death once and for all and resurrect the billions of humans who are in his memory.
(Yohanes 5:28, 29; Nyaɖeɖefia 21:3, 4) Ɣemaɣi la, mí katã míagblɔ apostolo Paulo ƒe nya siawo be: "Ku, wò dziɖuɖu ɖe?
(John 5:28, 29; Revelation 21:3, 4) Then, all can echo the words of the apostle Paul: "Death, where is your victory?
Ku, afi kae wò ti si nètsɔ le ame tém la le? " 1 Korintotɔwo 15:55.
Death, where is your sting? " 1 Corinthians 15:55.
AGBEMEŊKEKE MAMLƐAWO
THE FINAL WEEKS OF LIFE
Ebɔ be dzesi siwo gbɔna la dometɔ aɖewo alo wo katã nadze le dɔnɔ aɖe si le eƒe agbemeŋkeke mamIɛawo me ŋu :
It is common for a patient to exhibit some or all of the following symptoms during the final weeks of life :
Nuɖuɖu kple tsinono megadzroa dɔnɔa o.
Little interest in eating and drinking.
Woate ŋu atsɔ ɖetifu ade atike aɖe si nye glycerin me asisi ɖe nu to na dɔnɔa eye woade papahu dzadzɛ tsi me ada ɖe dɔnɔa ƒe ŋgonu be eƒe dzi nadze eme.
Swabbing glycerin on the mouth and lips and placing a moist washcloth on the forehead may keep the patient comfortable.
Dɔnɔa madi be ame aɖeke loo alo ame gbogbowo nanɔ ye gbɔ o.
Desire to be alone or with very few people.
Miganɔ toɣli ɖem dɔnɔa o.
Keep the environment quiet and calm.
Dɔnɔa anɔ alɔ̃ dɔm fũu.
Increased amount of time sleeping.
Dɔnɔa atsi mavomavo.
Restlessness.
Le esi nànɔ agbagba dzem be yealée ate ɖi sesẽe teƒe la, dze agbagba nànɔ enu blem ɖɔɖɔɖɔ eye nàde dzi ƒo nɛ boŋ.
Rather than restraining restless motions, speak calmly and reassuringly with the person.
Dɔnɔa magade dzesi ame tututu o.
Disorientation.
Yɔ wò ŋkɔ na dɔnɔa, eye nàɖo to dzigbɔɖitɔe ne edze abe dɔnɔa tɔtɔ ene hã.
Identify yourself by name, and listen with respect even if the person seems confused.
Aɖuɖɔɖɔɖɔ alo mĩnyenye ɖe aba dzi.
Incontinence.
Kpɔ egbɔ be dɔnɔa ŋutɔ kple eƒe aba dzi le dzadzɛ ale si wòanya wɔ.
Keep the patient and his bed clean to the extent possible.
Gbɔgbɔ manɔ dɔnɔa sum o.
Breathing changes.
Ne dɔnɔa le gbɔgbɔm eye wòle ŋeŋem la, ɖewohĩ eƒe vehlo si me gbɔdzɔ me ko tom ya le.
A moaning sound while exhaling may merely be air passing over relaxed vocal chords.
Dɔnɔa ƒe ŋɔti me axe.
Congestion.
Ne ède suɖui dɔnɔa ƒe ta te la, akpe ɖe eŋu be eƒe ŋɔti me nagaxe o.
Raising the head with pillows may help to prevent the patient from gagging.
Dɔnɔa ƒe ŋutigbalẽ atrɔ.
Skin color changes.
Esia dzɔna ne ametia le agbagba dzem be yeana ʋu nasi ayi ametia ƒe akpa vevi aɖewo.
These are often due to the body’s directing blood to the core to support vital organs.

MARRIAGE can be a challenge, but when one mate becomes chronically ill while the other remains healthy, complications can multiply.
Ðe srɔ̃wò le nɔnɔme sia tɔgbi me, si gbɔ wòle be nàkpɔa?
Are you caring for an infirm mate?
Ne nenemae la, ɖe biabia siwo gbɔna la dometɔ aɖe ɖea fu na wòa: ‘Ðe mate ŋu anɔ te ɖe enu ne srɔ̃nye ƒe lãmegbegblẽa gava nyra ɖe edzia?
If so, do any of the following questions worry you: ‘How will I cope if my mate’s health declines even further?
Ɣeyiɣi didi kae mate ŋu ayi edzi anɔ srɔ̃nyea gbɔ kpɔm, eye maganɔ nuɖaɖa, aƒemedzadzraɖo, kple dɔwɔɖui nyawo hã gbɔ kpɔm?
How long can I continue to take care of my mate and also do all the cooking, cleaning, and secular work?
Nu ka tae wònye be nyee le lãmesẽ me anɔ fu siawo kpem?’
Why do I feel guilty for being the healthy one?’
Le go bubu me la, ne wòe le dɔa lém la, ɖewohĩ àbia ɖokuiwò be: ‘Aleke mate ŋu ade bubu ɖokuinye ŋu le esi nyemegate ŋu wɔa naneke le ɖokuinye si o?
On the other hand, if you are the ailing spouse, you might wonder: ‘How can I respect myself when I’m unable to carry my load of responsibility?
Ðe nye nu vea dɔ me na srɔ̃nye, le nye dɔlélea ta?
Does my mate resent me for being sick?
Míaƒe dzidzɔkpɔkpɔ le srɔ̃ɖeɖea me ƒe seɖoƒee nye esia?’
Is our happiness as a couple over?’
Nublanuitɔe la, srɔ̃ɖeɖe geɖewo me gblẽ le esi dɔmavɔleameŋu dze ame ɖeka dzi ta.
Sadly, some marriages have not survived the strain caused by a chronic illness.
Gake esia mefia be nenema kokokoe wòanɔ le miawo hã gome o.
Yet, this does not mean that your marriage is doomed to failure.
Srɔ̃tɔ geɖewo te ŋu nɔ te ɖe nɔnɔmea nu, eye wokpɔa dzidzɔ hã, togbɔ be dɔmavɔleameŋu ɖe kpe na wo dometɔ ɖeka hã.
Many couples survive and even thrive despite the presence of a chronic ailment.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, bu Yoshiaki kple Kazuko ŋu kpɔ.
Consider, for example, Yoshiaki and Kazuko.
Dɔléle aɖe si gblẽa nu le ame ƒe dzimeƒu ŋu la wɔe be Yoshiaki megate ŋu wɔa naneke kura le eɖokui si o.
A spinal injury rendered Yoshiaki unable to make even the slightest movement without assistance.
Kazuko gblɔ be: "Ele be mawɔ nu sia nu na srɔ̃nye.
Kazuko explains: "My husband needs assistance with everything.
Egbɔkpɔkpɔ wɔe be nye kɔ, abɔtawo, kple abɔwo katã va nɔ veyem, eye medea ƒunukpeƒewo kple dzimeƒuwo ŋuti dɔyɔƒe aɖe enuenu.
As a result of caring for him, my neck, shoulders, and arms ache, and I am an outpatient at an orthopedic hospital.
Mesena le ɖokuinye me zi geɖe be dɔnɔdzikpɔkpɔ mele bɔbɔe kura o. "
I often feel that caregiving is overwhelming. "
Togbɔ be nɔnɔmeawo sesẽ alea hã la, Kazuko gblɔ be: "Míaƒe srɔ̃ɖekadodoa me gava sẽ ɖe edzi wu. "
Despite the difficulties, however, Kazuko says: "Our bond as a couple has become stronger. "
Ekema, nu vevi kae nana wokpɔa dzidzɔ le nɔnɔme siawo tɔgbi me?
What, then, is the key to happiness under such circumstances?

Nu vevi siwo nana ame siwo le nɔnɔme sia me la yia edzi nɔa dzidzɔ kpɔm le woƒe srɔ̃ɖeɖea me eye woƒe dzi dzea eme lae nye ale si wobua dɔlélea be yewo ame evea siaa dzie wòdze, ke menye ame si tsi aba dzi la koe o.
For one thing, those who retain a healthy measure of satisfaction and contentment in their marriage view the illness as an assault not only on the ailing spouse but on the two of them as a couple.
Nya lae nye be ne srɔ̃tɔ ɖeka dze dɔ la, wo ame evea katã kpea fu le mɔ aɖe nu godoo.
After all, if one mate is sick, both are deeply affected, even if in different ways.
Woƒo nu tso ɖekawɔwɔ blibo sia si wòle be wòanɔ srɔ̃ŋutsu kple srɔ̃nyɔnu dome la ŋu le 1 Mose 2:24 be: "Ŋutsu agblẽ fofoa kple dadaa ɖi ahaku ɖe srɔ̃a ŋuti, eye woanye ŋutilã ɖeka. "
This interdependent relationship between a husband and wife is described at Genesis 2:24: "A man will leave his father and his mother and he must stick to his wife and they must become one flesh. "
Eya ta ne dɔmavɔleameŋu dze srɔ̃tɔ ɖeka dzi la, ele be wo ame evea woawɔ nu adudu le akɔkpekpe kple kuxia me.
Thus, when a spouse has an ongoing physical ailment, it is critical that both husband and wife work together to meet the challenge.

Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, numekukuwo ɖee fia be srɔ̃tɔ siwo naa ƒomedodo kplikplikpli nɔa wo dome la ƒe nɔnɔmea metia wo o, togbɔ be dɔmavɔleameŋu ɖe kpe na wo dometɔ ɖeka hã, eye wote ŋu srɔ̃a mɔ nyuitɔ siwo dzi woato atrɔ ɖe nɔnɔmeawo ŋu.
Additionally, research shows that couples who maintain a good relationship in the face of chronic illness accept their situation and learn effective ways to adapt to it.
Mɔ nyuitɔ siawo siwo wosrɔ̃ tsɔ nɔa te ɖe nɔnɔmeawo nu la ɖo kpe ale si aɖaŋuɖoɖo siwo le Biblia me la ɖea vi ɣesiaɣi la dzi.
Many of the coping skills that they have learned echo the timeless advice found in the Bible.
Bu aɖaŋuɖoɖo etɔ̃ siwo gbɔna la ŋu kpɔ.
Consider the following three suggestions.
Miɖe Ameŋububu Fia Mia Nɔewo
Show Consideration for One Another
Nyagblɔla 4:9 gblɔ be: "Ne ame le eve la, enyo wu ame ɖeka. "
"Two are better than one, " states Ecclesiastes 4:9.
Nu ka tae?
Why?
Kpukpui 10 lia gblɔ be: "Ne wo dometɔ ɖeka dze anyi la, nɔvia afɔe ɖe tsitre. "
Because, explains verse 10, "if one of them should fall, the other one can raise his partner up. "
Ðe nègblɔa ŋudzedzekpɔɖeameŋunyawo ‘tsɔ fɔna srɔ̃wò ɖe tsitrea’?
Do you ‘raise your partner up’ with expressions of appreciation?
Ðe miete ŋu dia mɔnu siwo dzi miato ana kpekpeɖeŋu mia nɔewoa?
Are you able to look for ways to be of practical assistance to each other?
Yong, si srɔ̃nyɔnu ƒe akpa ɖeka tu la gblɔ be: "Medzea agbagba ɖea ameŋububu fiaa srɔ̃nye ɣesiaɣi.
Yong, whose wife is partially paralyzed, says: "I try to be considerate of my wife on every occasion.
Ne tsikɔ le wuyem la, mebua eŋu be tsikɔ anya nɔ eya hã wum.
Whenever I feel thirsty, I consider that she too might be thirsty.
Ne meɖoe be mayi aɖaɖi tsa le teƒe dzeaniwo la, mebianɛ ne adi be yeayi kplim.
If I want to go outside and view the beautiful scenery, I ask her if she would like to join me.
Míesea veve hedoa dzi ɖekae. "
We are sharing the pain and enduring the situation together. "
Le go bubu me la, ne wòe nye dɔnɔa la, ɖe nàte ŋu awɔ nanewo na ɖokuiwò, si magblẽ nu le wò lãmesẽ ŋu oa?
On the other hand, if you are receiving care from your mate, are there certain things that you can do for yourself without threatening your health?
Ne èwɔe alea la, ate ŋu ana nàde asixɔxɔ ɖokuiwò ŋu, eye wòate ŋu akpe ɖe srɔ̃wò ŋu be wòayi edzi anɔ be lém na wò.
If so, this can boost your feelings of self-worth and may contribute to your mate’s ability to continue providing care.
Le esi teƒe be nàsusui be yenya mɔ nyuitɔ si dzi yeato aɖe ameŋububu afia ye srɔ̃ la, ɖe manyo be nàbiae wòagblɔ nu si adze eŋu wu la na wò oa?
Rather than assume that you know the best way to show consideration for your spouse, why not ask him or her what would be most appreciated?
Nancy, si ŋu míeƒo nu tso le nyati sia ƒe gɔmedzedze la va gblɔ ale si wòtena ɖe edzi be yemegasea nya aɖeke tso ƒomea ƒe ganyawo ŋu o la na srɔ̃a mlɔeba.
Nancy, mentioned at the outset, eventually told her husband how she was affected by not knowing the family’s financial status.
Fifia la, srɔ̃a dzea agbagba ɖoa dze kplii tso eŋu.
Now her husband endeavors to be more communicative in this regard.
TE MƆNU SIA KPƆ: Ŋlɔ nu siwo nèsusu be ne srɔ̃wò wɔ na wò la, ana nɔnɔmea naka ɖe eme vie la ɖi, eye nàna srɔ̃wòa hã nawɔe nenema.
TRY THIS: List ways that you feel your mate can make your present situation a little easier, and have your spouse do the same.
Azɔ mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe natsɔ eƒe nuŋlɔɖia na nɔvia.
Then switch lists.
Mia dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe netia nu siwo nɔvia ŋlɔ la dometɔ ɖeka alo eve siwo dzi wɔwɔ anya wɔ.
Each of you should select one or two suggestions that can realistically be implemented.
Ðoɖowɔɖi Si Da Sɔ Nenɔ Mia Si
Have a Balanced Schedule
Nunyala Fia Salomo ŋlɔ be: ‘Ɣeyiɣi li na nu sia nu.’
"For everything there is an appointed time, " wrote wise King Solomon.
(Nyagblɔla 3:1) Ke hã, ate ŋu adze abe manya wɔ be woawɔ ɖoɖowɔɖi si da sɔ o ene, le ale si dɔmavɔleameŋu me tsonuwo ate ŋu anɔ ƒomea ƒe ɖoɖowo me tɔtɔm ta.
(Ecclesiastes 3:1) However, it may seem impossible to maintain a balanced schedule, given the disrupting effect that a chronic sickness can have on a family’s routine.
Nu kae miate ŋu awɔ be dadasɔ aɖe si nu ya nanɔ miaƒe ɖoɖowɔɖiwo me?
What can you do to achieve at least a measure of balance?
Miwɔ ɖoɖo ɖekae mianɔ gome kpɔm le nuwɔna siwo ana mianɔ susu ɖem ɖa le dɔlélea dzi vie tso ɣeyiɣi yi ɣeyiɣi la me.
Together you might take regular breaks from serious medical concerns.
Ðe miagate ŋu awɔ nu siwo miewɔna ɖekae tsã hafi dɔlélea va do mo ɖa la dometɔ aɖewo akea?
Can you still enjoy some of the things you shared before illness struck?
Ne manya wɔ nenema o la, nu bubu kawoe miate ŋu awɔ?
If not, what new activities can you try?
Ate ŋu anye nu bɔbɔe aɖe ko abe nuxexlẽ na mia nɔewo loo, alo nu siwo wɔwɔ bia agbagba dzedze geɖe, abe gbegbɔgblɔ bubu sɔsrɔ̃ ene.
It could be something as simple as reading to each other or as challenging as learning a new language.
Nu siwo ana miaɖe susu ɖa le dɔlélea dzi vie la wɔwɔ ɖekae ate ŋu ado ŋusẽ miaƒe "ŋutilã ɖeka " ƒe kadodoa eye esia adzi miaƒe dzidzɔkpɔkpɔ ɖe edzi.
Having a life together outside the illness will strengthen your "one flesh " bond​ and increase your happiness.
Nu bubu si hã akpe ɖe mia ŋu miada asɔe nye hadede kple ame bubuwo.
Another aid to maintaining balance is being in the company of others.
Biblia gblɔ le Lododowo 18:1 be: ‘Ame si ɖe eɖokui ɖe aga le eya ŋutɔ ƒe dzodzro yome dim la, etsia tre ɖe nunyanyawo katã ŋu.’
The Bible states at Proverbs 18:1: "One isolating himself will seek his own selfish longing; against all practical wisdom he will break forth. "
Ðe nède dzesii le kpukpui sia me be ame ɖokui ɖeɖe ɖe aga ate ŋu agblẽ nu le ame ƒe tamesusu ŋua?
Did you note in that verse that isolation can have an undesirable effect on the mind?
To vovo na ema la, hadede kple ame bubuwo enuenu ate ŋu ana wò dzi nadze eme eye wò susu me hã nadze akɔ anyi.
By contrast, periodic association with others can lift your spirits and help restore mental perspective.
Ðe manyo be wò ŋutɔ nàkpe ame aɖe be wòava srã wò kpɔ oa?
Why not take the initiative to invite someone to visit you?
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, esesẽna na srɔ̃tɔ siwo le wo srɔ̃ dɔnɔwo dzi kpɔm la be woada asɔ.
At times, balance becomes a problem for caregiving spouses.
Wo dometɔ aɖewo ƒoa wo ɖokuiwo ɖe dɔ geɖe akpa wɔwɔ me, si wɔnɛ be nu nɔa wo ŋu tem vivivi, eye wògblẽa nu le woƒe lãmesẽ ŋu.
Some take on too much work, slowly wear down, and endanger their own health.
Ate ŋu ava dzɔ be nu ava te wo ŋu ale gbegbe be womagava te ŋu anɔ wo srɔ̃ lɔlɔ̃a gbɔ kpɔm gɔ̃ hã o.
Eventually, they may even render themselves unable to continue providing care for their beloved mate.
Eya ta ne èle srɔ̃wò si dɔmavɔleameŋu le fu ɖem na gbɔ kpɔm la, mègaŋe aɖaba ƒu wò ŋutɔ wò lãmesẽnyawo dzi o.
So if you are taking care of a chronically ill spouse, do not ignore your personal needs.
Ðo ɣeyiɣi aɖewo koŋ ɖi nàtsɔ anɔ ɖiɖim ɖe eme edziedzi.
Set aside regular quiet time to refresh yourself.
Ame aɖewo kpɔe be edea yewoƒe lãmesẽ dzi ŋutɔ ne yewoƒoa nu tso yewoƒe dzimaɖitsitsiwo ŋu na yewo xɔlɔ̃ si dzi yewo ka ɖo, si ƒe vidzinu meto vovo na wo tɔ o, la tso ɣeyiɣi yi ɣeyiɣi.
Some have found it therapeutic to talk out their anxieties from time to time with a trusted friend of the same sex.
TE MƆNU SIA KPƆ: Ŋlɔ kuxi siwo nèdoa goe le srɔ̃wòa gbɔ kpɔkpɔ me la ɖi.
TRY THIS: List on paper the obstacles you face in taking care of your mate.
Emegbe ŋlɔ afɔ siwo nèkpɔ be yeate ŋu aɖe atsɔ akpɔ wo gbɔ alo anɔ te ɖe wo nu nyuie la ɖi.
Then make a list of steps you might take to overcome these or to cope with them more effectively.
Le esi teƒe be nànɔ afɔɖeɖe siawo dometɔ ɖe sia ɖe ŋu bum fũu akpa la, bia ɖokuiwò be, ‘Wo dometɔ ka ŋu dɔ wɔwɔe anɔ bɔbɔe wu, si dze ƒãa be ana nɔnɔmea naka ɖe eme?’
Instead of overanalyzing them, ask yourself, ‘What is the simplest, most obvious way to improve the situation?’
Na Nukpɔsusu Nyui Nanɔ Asiwò
Try to Maintain a Positive Outlook
Biblia xlɔ̃ nu be: ‘Mègagblɔ be, nu ka ta tsã ŋkekewo nyo wu fifitɔwo hã o.’ (Nyagblɔla 7:10) Eya ta ƒo asa na ale si nuwo anɔ ne ɖe medze dɔ o la ŋu bubu.
The Bible warns: "Do not say: ‘Why has it happened that the former days proved to be better than these?’ " (Ecclesiastes 7:10) So avoid dwelling on what might have been.
Ðo ŋku edzi be le xexe sia me la, seɖoƒe li na dzidzɔ ɖe sia ɖe si míakpɔ la le mɔ aɖe nu.
Remember that in this world, all happiness is limited in some way.
Nu si le vevie ye nye be nàlɔ̃ ɖe nɔnɔme si me nèle la dzi, eye nàwɔ nu siwo nàte ŋu awɔ be wò dzi nadze eme.
The key here is to accept your situation and make the best of it.
Nu kae ate ŋu akpe ɖe mia kple srɔ̃wòa ŋu le go sia me?
What can help you and your mate in this regard?
Miɖo dze tso miaƒe yayrawo ŋu ɖekae.
Discuss your blessings together.
Kpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe tɔtrɔ nyui ɖe sia ɖe si nàde dzesi le wò lãmegbegblẽa ŋu la ŋu ɣesiaɣi.
Take delight in even the smallest improvements in your health.
Mibu nu nyui siwo miate ŋu anɔ mɔ kpɔm na la ŋu, eye miaɖo taɖodzinu siwo gbɔ miate ŋu aɖo la na mia ɖokui.
Find things to look forward to, and set reachable goals together.
Atsu kple asi siwo nye Shoji kple Akiko wɔ ɖe aɖaŋuɖoɖo sia dzi, eye wòɖe vi geɖe na wo.
A couple named Shoji and Akiko have applied the above advice with good results.
Esi lãmekaveame dɔléle aɖe va dze Akiko dzi la, enɔ na wo be woaɖe asi le Kristotɔwo ƒe ɣeyiɣiawo katã ƒe subɔsubɔdɔ tɔxɛ si wɔm wonɔ la ŋu.
At one point after Akiko was diagnosed with fibromyalgia, they had to leave a special assignment in the full-time Christian ministry.
Ðe dzi ɖe le wo ƒoa?
Were they disappointed?
Dzi anya ɖe le wo ƒo ya.
Naturally.
Gake Shoji ƒe nuxlɔ̃ame sia le yiyim na ame siwo le nɔnɔme ma me be: "Mègana dzi naɖe le ƒowò to nu siwo màgate ŋu awɔ o la ŋu bubu me o.
Yet, Shoji advises any in similar circumstances: "Do not discourage yourself by thinking about things that you can no longer do.
Na nukpɔsusu nyui nanɔ asiwò.
Keep a positive outlook.
Ne mɔkpɔkpɔ li be nɔnɔmeawo ava ɖɔ ɖo le etsɔme hã la, miaƒe susu nenɔ nu siwo miate ŋu awɔ fifia dzi.
Even if you both have the hope of returning to a normal routine someday, concentrate for now on your life as it is.
Le gonyeme la, nu si mewɔna ye nye be menaa nye susu katã kuna ɖe srɔ̃nyea kple ale si makpe ɖe eŋui la ŋu. "
For me, that means focusing my attention on my wife and helping her. "
4 Dɔmavɔleameŋu si anɔ fu ɖem na srɔ̃tɔ ɖeka la koŋ ŋue woƒo nu tso le nyati sia me.
Such practical advice can help you too if your spouse has special needs.
BIA ÐOKUIWÒ BE . . .
ASK YOURSELF . . .
Nu kae hiã vevie wu be mía kple srɔ̃nye míawɔ fifi laa?
What do my mate and I most need to do right now?
▪ Míanɔ dze ɖom tso dɔlélea ŋu geɖe wu
Talk more about the illness
▪ Míanɔ dze ɖom tso dɔlélea ŋu fũu o
Talk less about the illness
▪ Míatsi dzimaɖi fũu o
Worry less
▪ Míaɖe ameŋububu afia mía nɔewo geɖe wu
Show more consideration for each other
▪ Míanɔ nu siwo míate ŋu awɔ ɖekae atsɔ aɖe susu ɖa le dɔlélea ŋu vie la wɔm
Have a mutual interest outside the illness
▪ Míanɔ ha dem kple ame bubuwo geɖe wu
Have more social contact
▪ Míaɖo taɖodzinu siwo asɔ na mí
Have mutual goals
Nu Si Wòle Be Nànya Tso Tagbɔdɔléle Ŋu
What You Should Know About Mental Disorders

Esi wogblɔ na Claudia teti be tagbɔdɔ si nana wowɔa nu kple dzonɔameme si gbɔ eme kple tagbɔdɔléle si ɖea fu na ame siwo kpɔ ŋɔdzinuwo teƒe le eŋu la, egblɔ be, "Ðeko wòwɔ abe gbɔgbɔtsixe tsi ƒonye ene.
"I felt as though I had my breath knocked out of me, " says Claudia, who had just been told she had bipolar disorder and post-traumatic stress disorder.
Ewɔ nam be nyemate ŋu anɔ te ɖe ale si amewo awɔ nu ne wonya be tagbɔdɔ le ŋunye la nu o ene.
"Dealing with the stigma of a mental illness seemed overwhelming. "
Claudia srɔ̃, Mark, gblɔ be: "Exɔ ɣeyiɣi ŋutɔ hafi míete ŋu va trɔ ɖe nɔnɔmea ŋu.
"It took a long time to come to terms with our situation, " says Claudia’s husband, Mark.
Gake mekpɔe dze sii be ele be matsi dzi ɖe ale si makpe ɖe srɔ̃nyea ŋu wu. "
"But I realized that I had to focus on supporting my wife. "
ALEKE nàse le ɖokuiwò me ne wokpɔ tagbɔdɔléle le wò ŋutɔ alo wò ame vevi aɖe ŋu?
IF YOU or someone you love were diagnosed with a mental disorder, how would you feel?
Dzidzɔtɔe la, wotea ŋu daa tagbɔdɔlélewo.
Thankfully, mental illness can be treated.
Na míadzro nu ʋɛ aɖewo siwo akpe ɖe ŋuwò nànya nu geɖe tso tagbɔdɔléle ŋu la me.
Let us examine a few things you should know that will give you a better understanding of mental disorders.
Tagbɔdɔléle Ŋuti Nya Vevi Aɖewo
Key Facts About Mental Health
"Ame miliɔn alafa geɖe léa tagbɔdɔ le xexea me godoo eye wòkpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe woƒe ame veviwo hã dzi.
"Mental disorders afflict hundreds of millions of people in every part of the world and impact on the lives of their loved ones.
Anyigbadzitɔ ɖeka le ene ɖe sia ɖe me alé tagbɔdɔ ɣeaɖeɣi le eƒe agbe me godoo.
One in four people will be affected by mental disorder at some point in their lives.
Blanuiléledɔ koŋue nana amewo léa tagbɔdɔ le xexea me.
Depression is the single largest contributor to worldwide disability.
Tagbɔdɔ si nana wotɔtɔna kple tagbɔdɔ si nana wowɔa nu kple dzonɔameme si gbɔ eme lae nye tagbɔdɔ siwo vɔ̃ɖi hegblẽa nu le ame ŋu wu. . . .
Schizophrenia and bipolar disorder are among the most severe and disabling disorders. . . .
Togbɔ be tagbɔdɔ le ame gbogbo aɖewo ŋu hã la, womenya o, ame aɖewo hã metsɔa ɖeke le eme o eye ame bubuwo hã mewɔa nu ɖe tagbɔdɔlélawo ŋu nyuie o. "
Although huge numbers of people are affected, mental disorders remain hidden, neglected and discriminated against. "
Xexea Me Lãmesẽ Habɔbɔ..
World Health Organization (WHO).
Xexea Me Lãmesẽ Habɔbɔ gblɔ be tagbɔdɔléla geɖewo metsɔa woƒe dɔléleawo yia kɔdzi o le ŋukpe ta.
According to WHO, many people with mental illness refrain from seeking treatment because of the stigma associated with it.

Togbɔ be woate ŋu ada tagbɔdɔ akpa gãtɔ hã la, United States Dukɔa Ƒe Tagbɔdɔlélawo Ƒe Kpekpeɖeŋunahabɔbɔ gblɔ be Amerikatɔ tsitsi siwo ade 60 le alafa me kloe kple sɔhɛ siwo xɔ ƒe 8 va se ɖe ƒe 15 dometɔ 50 le alafa me siwo le tagbɔdɔ lém la meyi kɔdzi be woada dɔ na yewo le ƒe si va yi me o.

Although most mental disorders are treatable, in the United States approximately 60 percent of adults and almost 50 percent of youths aged 8 to 15 with a mental disorder did not receive treatment in the past year, reports the National Alliance on Mental Illness.
Nu Kae Nye Tagbɔdɔléle?
Understanding Mental Disorders
Nyɔnu aɖe le srɔ̃a si le tagbɔdɔ lém la kpɔm
A woman with a mental disorder What is mental illness?
Numekulawo gblɔ be tagbɔdɔléle nye ame ƒe tamebubu, eƒe seselelãme kple nuwɔnawo ƒe masɔmasɔ kura.
Experts define a mental disorder as a significant dysfunction in a person’s thinking, emotional control, and behavior.
Zi geɖe la, dɔlélea wɔnɛ be amea kple ame bubuwo dome menɔa nyuie o, eye metea ŋu nɔa te ɖe agbemehloloetsotsowo hã nu o.
The condition often disrupts a person’s ability to relate to others and to deal with the demands of life.
Menye ame ƒe gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔ alo eƒe numawɔmawɔ nyuie gbɔe tagbɔdɔléle tsona o
Mental-health disorders are not the result of personal weakness or a character flaw
Ɣeyiɣi didi si dɔlélea axɔ kple ale si gbegbe enu asẽe nɔa te ɖe dɔa léla ƒe lãmesẽ kple eƒe nɔnɔmewo dzi.
The severity of symptoms can vary in length and intensity, depending on the individual and the particular ailment and circumstances.
Ame sia ame ate ŋu alée, eɖanye ŋutsu alo nyɔnu o, ɖevi alo ame tsitsi o, agbalẽnyala alo agbalẽmanyala o, kesinɔtɔ alo ame dahe o.
It can affect people of any gender, age, culture, race, religion, or educational and income level.
Menye ame ƒe gbɔdzɔgbɔdzɔ alo eƒe numawɔmawɔ nyuie gbɔe tagbɔdɔléle tsona o.
Mental-health disorders are not the result of personal weakness or a character flaw.
Ne woda tagbɔdɔa na amea nyuie la, ate ŋu akpɔ ta na eƒe agbe ahakpɔ dzidzeme.
Through appropriate medical care, individuals can be treated and can live a productive and fulfilling life.
Tagbɔdɔwo Dada
Treating Mental Disorders
Tagbɔdɔdalawo ate ŋu ada tagbɔdɔléle geɖewo keŋkeŋ.
Mental-health professionals can treat many mental-health disorders successfully.
Afɔ vevi gbãtɔ si wòle be tagbɔdɔléla naɖee nye be wòaku nu me tso eƒe dɔlélea ŋu le tagbɔdɔdala bibi aɖe gbɔ.
The first crucial step, then, is to obtain a thorough assessment from a competent health professional who is experienced in treating mental conditions.
Nyɔnu aɖe si le tagbɔdɔ lém la le nu ƒom kple dɔdala bibi aɖe
A woman with a mental disorder talking with a qualified health professional
Gake ne tagbɔdɔléla la ɖe mɔ woda dɔa nɛ ale si dze ko hafi wòate ŋu ahaya keŋkeŋ.
Sufferers, however, can benefit from such experience only when they accept suitable treatment.
Esia abia be wòaɖe ŋukpe aku ati ahaƒo nu tso eƒe kuxia ŋu na ame bubuwo.
This may require overcoming any reluctance to talk to others about a mental illness.

Dɔa dada ate ŋu abia be wòaƒo nu tso eƒe dɔa ŋu na tagbɔdɔdala bibi aɖe si ate ŋu akpe ɖe eŋu wòase nɔnɔmea gɔme nyuie, wòatrɔ asi le nanewo koŋ ŋu, eye wòaɖoe kplikpaa be yemadzudzɔ atikeawo zazã o va se ɖe esime yehaya keŋkeŋ.
Treatment may include talking to trained mental-health professionals who can help them understand their illness, resolve practical problems, and reinforce the need not to give up the treatment.
Dɔa léla ƒe ƒometɔwo alo exɔlɔ̃wo ate ŋu awɔ akpa vevi aɖe ne wonaa kakaɖedzii hedea dzi ƒo nɛ ne wole dze ɖom tso nɔnɔmea ŋu.
At such consultations, a family member or friend can play a vital role by providing reassurance and support.
Tagbɔdɔléla geɖe te ŋu le te nɔm ɖe woƒe dɔléleawo nu esi wova nya nu tso woƒe dɔléleawo ŋu nyuie eye wowɔa dɔdalawo ƒe mɔfiamewo dzi.
Many people have learned to deal with mental disorders after acquiring a better understanding of their condition and following the treatment prescribed by mental-health professionals.
Mark, si nye Claudia srɔ̃, gblɔ be: "Do ŋgɔ na srɔ̃nye ƒe dɔdzedzea la, míenya nu boo tso tagbɔdɔléle ŋu o.
"Before my wife was diagnosed, " says Mark, quoted earlier, "we had little understanding of mental illness.
Gake míesrɔ̃ ale si míakpɔ kuxi ɖe sia ɖe gbɔ ne enya do mo ɖa.
But we’ve learned to take life one step at a time and adapt to our situation.
Le ɣeyiɣi aɖe megbe la, dɔdala siwo ŋu kakaɖedzi le kple míaƒe ƒometɔwo kpakple mía xɔlɔ̃wo ƒe aɖaŋuɖoɖowo va ɖe vi na mí ŋutɔ. "
Over time, we have benefited from the support of reliable professionals as well as family and friends. "
Afɔ vevi gbãtɔ si wòle be tagbɔdɔléla naɖee nye be wòaku nu me tso eƒe dɔlélea ŋu le tagbɔdɔdala bibi aɖe gbɔ
The first crucial step is to obtain a thorough medical assessment from a competent health professional
Srɔ̃a Claudia lɔ̃ ɖe eƒe nyaa dzi.
Claudia agrees.
Egblɔ be: "Esi wokpɔ dɔa le ŋunye le gɔmedzedzea me la, ɖeko wòwɔ abe ɖe wodrɔ̃ ʋɔnum be mayi mɔ́ ene.
"In the beginning, my diagnosis felt like a prison sentence, " she admits.
Togbɔ be nye dɔlélea wɔe be nye kple srɔ̃nye siaa míegatea ŋu wɔa nanewo o hã la, mesrɔ̃e be míate ŋu aɖu mɔxenu siwo dzena abe ɖe womate ŋu awɔ naneke tso wo ŋu o ene la dzi.
"But even though my illness places limitations on both of us, I have learned that seemingly impossible hurdles can be overcome.
Eya ta be manɔ te ɖe nye dɔlélea nu la, mewɔa nu aduadu kple nye dɔdalawo, menɔa kadodo nyui me kple amewo, eye nyemetsɔa kuxiwo doa agba na ɖokuinye o. "
So I cope with my mental illness by working together with my treatment team, nurturing relationships with others, and taking one moment at a time. "
Mawusubɔsubɔ Le Vevie
Spiritual Health Is Vital
Nyɔnu aɖe le Biblia xlẽm
A woman reading the Bible
Biblia megblɔ be mawusubɔsubɔ daa lãmegbegblẽwo le ame ŋu o.
The Bible does not indicate that spirituality cures medical problems.
Ke hã, ƒome geɖewo le xexea me godoo kpɔa akɔfafa kple ŋusẽdoame geɖe tso Biblia ƒe nufiafiawo me.
Still, many families around the world have derived much comfort and strength from what the Bible teaches.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, Biblia na kakaɖedzi mí be mía Wɔla lɔ̃ame la di vevie be yeafa akɔ na ame siwo ƒe "dzi gbã gudugudu " kple ame siwo ƒe "gbɔgbɔ woƒo ƒu anyi. "
For instance, the Bible assures us that our loving Creator is keenly interested in consoling those who are "brokenhearted " and "crushed in spirit. "
Psalmo 34:19.
Psalm 34:18.
Menye atikewɔgbalẽe Biblia nye o, gake mɔfiame nyuiwo le eme siwo ate ŋu akpe ɖe mía ŋu míanɔ te ɖe nɔnɔme donuxaxanamewo nu.
While the Bible is not a health-care book, it provides practical guidance that can help us to cope with painful emotions and distressing circumstances.
Biblia ate ŋu ana be etsɔmemɔkpɔkpɔ si nye be ɣeyiɣi aɖe gbɔna si me anyigbadzinɔla aɖeke magadze dɔ alo ase veve o la nasu mía si.
The Bible can also give us hope for a future when life on earth will be free of illness and pain.
Mawu ƒe Nya la do ŋugbe be: "Ŋkuagbãtɔwo ƒe ŋku aʋu, eye tokunɔwo ƒe to aʋu; ekema xɔdrɔ̃wo ati kpo abe zi ene, eye aɖetututɔwo ƒe aɖe atso aseye; elabena tɔ ŋɔ tso gbegbe, eye tɔʋu tso tagba. "

God’s Word promises: "At that time the eyes of the blind will be opened, and the ears of the deaf will be unstopped. At that time the lame will leap like the deer, and the tongue of the speechless will shout for joy. "
Yesaya 35:5, 6.
Isaiah 35:5, 6.
Ne Tagbɔdɔléle Le Ŋuwò
LIVING WITH MENTAL ILLNESS
"Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, dziɖeleameƒo nana be nanewo wɔwɔ zua dɔ nam, eye ɣeaɖewoɣi hã, nye susu menɔa te kaka mahayi nu teti xlẽ ge o.
"There are times when the feeling of panic makes some activities seem impossible, and there are days when I can’t even concentrate well enough to read.
Ɣebubuɣiwo hã la, blanuilélea nu sẽna ale gbegbe be meƒoa asa na ame sia ame, xɔ̃nye veviwo gɔ̃ hã.
At other times, the darkness of depression makes me avoid contact with others, even good friends.
Amewo dea dzi ƒo nam be ele nyonyo ge kpuie alo be nɔnɔmea megblẽ abe ale si mesusui ene o.
Some try to help by suggesting that things will get better soon or that things aren’t as bad as I think they are.
Ame bubuwo gblɔna be mabu nu nyui siwo su asinye le agbe me la ŋu.
Others tell me to look on the brighter side of life.
Medze agbagba zi geɖe be mawɔ nu sia, gake gbeɖegbeɖea koe!
But I have tried to do that countless times!
Togbɔ be ɖe wogblɔa nya siawo be yewoatsɔ ade dzi ƒo nam hã la, ɖeko wòganana mebua fɔ ɖokuinye eye megasena le ɖokuinye me geɖe wu be viɖe mele ŋunye o, be medo kpo nu. "
Even though comments like these are well-meant, they simply increase the feelings of inadequacy, guilt, and failure I already experience. "
Claudia, South Africa.
Claudia, South Africa.
Tenɔnɔ Ðe Tagbɔdɔlélewo Nu
DEALING WITH MENTAL DISORDERS
Wɔ ɖe mɔfiame siwo dɔdalawo na wò la dzi.
Follow the treatment prescribed by qualified mental-health professionals.
Zɔ ɖe ɖoɖo aɖe si da sɔ la nu gbe sia gbe.
Maintain a balanced and stable daily routine.
Nɔ kame dem.
Stay physically active.
Nɔ alɔ̃ dɔm nyuie.
Get enough sleep.
Di ɣeyiɣi gbe sia gbe nàɖi ɖe eme.
Take time each day to relax.
Ðu nu siwo me nunyiame le.
Eat a nutritious and balanced diet.
Tso aha sesẽ nono kple atike muame siwo ɖɔkta meŋlɔ na wò o la zazã dzi.
Limit alcohol consumption and drugs that are not prescribed for you.
Mègaɖe ɖokuiwò ɖe aga o; de ha kple ame siwo dzi nèka ɖo eye wotsɔa ɖe le eme na wò.
Avoid isolation; spend time with people whom you trust and who care for you.
Do vevie mawusubɔsubɔ hã.
Give attention to your spiritual needs.
Suklidɔ Aleke Nàwɔ Aɖe Eƒe Afɔkua Dzi Kpɔtɔ?
Diabetes Can You Reduce Your Risk?
AME geɖe va le suklidɔ alo aɖuɖɔvividɔ lém ale gbegbe be eva zu xexea me godoo ƒe kuxi.
THE incidence of diabetes mellitus is increasing so quickly that it has become a global epidemic.
Suklidɔ siwo amewo léna wu la ƒomevi evee li.
There are two major types of diabetes.
Suklidɔ ƒomevi gbãtɔ dzea egɔme tso ɖevime, eye ɖɔktawo mekpɔ kpɔ ta nɛ o.
Type 1 starts mainly in childhood, and presently doctors do not know how to prevent it.
Míaƒo nu tso suklidɔ ƒomevi evelia, si le suklidɔléla 90 le alafa me ŋu la ŋuti le nyati sia me.
This article is about type 2, which accounts for about 90 percent of all diabetes.
Tsã la, wobunɛ be ame tsitsiwo koe léa suklidɔ ƒomevi evelia sia, gake fifia ɖeviwo hã va le dɔ sia lém.
While in the past it was seen as exclusive to adults, more recently type 2 diabetes has also been affecting children.
Ke hã dɔ sia ŋuti nunyalawo gblɔ be woate ŋu aƒo asa na suklidɔ ƒomevi evelia va se ɖe afi aɖe.
Experts claim, however, that the risk of type 2 diabetes can be reduced.
Ne ènya nu ʋɛ aɖewo tso dɔ vɔ̃ɖi sia ŋu la, aɖe vi geɖe na wò.
A little knowledge of this insidious disease may prove helpful to you.
Nu Kae Nye Suklidɔ?
What Is Diabetes?
Enye dɔléle si nana be sukli sɔa gbɔ ɖe ʋu me na ame fũu akpa.
Diabetes is a condition that causes a person to have an excessive level of blood sugar.
Dɔléle sia nana be ale si sukli toa ʋukawo me yia lãmenugbagbeviwo gbɔ be ŋusẽ nanɔ wo ŋu la megawɔa dɔ le ɖoɖo nu o.
The disease upsets the normal process of transferring sugar from the bloodstream into cells that need it for energy.
Esia gblẽa nu le ŋutinu vevi aɖewo ŋu, eye wònana hã be ʋu megasina le lã me na ame nyuie o.
The result is damage to vital organs and impairment of blood circulation, sometimes leading to toe or foot amputation, blindness, and kidney disease.
Ɣeaɖewoɣi la, esia tea ŋu wɔnɛ be wotsoa afɔ alo afɔbidɛ na amewo, ŋku gbãna na wo alo woléa ayikudɔ.
A large proportion of diabetes patients die of heart attacks or stroke.
Dzidɔ kple tutudɔ wua suklidɔléla gbogbo aɖewo.
Excess body fat can be a major factor in type 2 diabetes.
Dɔ sia ŋuti nunyalawo gblɔ be ne ami sɔ gbɔ ɖe dɔ me alo ali me na ame la, efia be amea le suklidɔ lé ge kpuie.
Experts believe that fat accumulated in the belly and waist may indicate a higher risk for diabetes.
Vevietɔ la, edze abe ne ami le ƒomeɖe kple aklã me la, enana be sukli megawɔa dɔ le lã me na ame nyuie o ene.
More specifically, fat in the pancreas and the liver appear to disrupt the body’s regulation of blood sugar.
Nu kae nàte ŋu awɔ atsɔ aɖe afɔku sia dzi kpɔtɔ?
What can you do to reduce your risk?
Nu Etɔ̃ Siwo Nàte Ŋu Awɔ Atsɔ Aɖe Suklidɔléle Ƒe Afɔkua Dzi Kpɔtɔ
Three Steps That May Reduce the Risk of Diabetes
Nɔ sukli si le lã me na wò la ƒe agbɔsɔsɔme dom kpɔ nenye be àte ŋu alé dɔ sia bɔbɔe.
Have your level of blood sugar tested if you are in a high-risk group.
Zi geɖe la, lãmesẽkuxi aɖe si nana be sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ si le ʋua me yia dzi wu ale si dze la doa ŋgɔ na suklidɔ ƒomevi evelia.
A medical disorder known as prediabetes a condition in which blood sugar is moderately higher than normal often precedes type 2 diabetes.
Sukli ƒe dzi yiyi kple suklidɔ siaa menyo o, gake vovototo le wo dome. Togbɔ be woate ŋu alé suklidɔ nu hã la, womekpɔ kpɔ atike si adae haɖe o.
Both conditions are unhealthy, but there is a difference: Although diabetes can be controlled, it cannot yet be cured.
Gake ame siwo sukli sɔ gbɔ ɖe ʋu me na dometɔ aɖewo te ŋu na sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔmea ɖɔ ɖo.
On the other hand, some prediabetics have been able to bring their blood sugar back to normal levels.
Sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ ɖe ʋu me na ame sia ƒe dzesi aɖeke medzena wokpɔna o.
Prediabetes may have no obvious symptoms.
Eya tae wòtea ŋu dzɔna be amewo menyana kura be dɔ sia le yewo ŋu o.
Hence, this condition may go unnoticed.
Le numekulawo ƒe nyatakaka nu la, lãmesẽkuxi sia si doa ŋgɔ na suklidɔa la le ame miliɔn 316 ŋu le xexea me godoo gake ame akpa gãtɔ menya o.
According to reports, about 316 million people around the world have prediabetes; yet, many of them do not realize it.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, woka nya ta be le United States ɖeɖe dzaa la, ame siwo sukli sɔ gbɔ ɖe ʋu me na akpa la dometɔ 90 le alafa me menya be kuxi sia le yewo ŋu o.
For instance, in the United States alone, some 90 percent of prediabetes sufferers are unaware of their condition.
Ke hã, sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ ɖe lã me na ame gblẽa nu le ame ŋu.
Prediabetes is not harmless, however.
Sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ ɖe lã me na ame siae hea suklidɔ ƒomevi evelia vɛ. Nyitsɔ laa la, wova de dzesii be etea ŋu nana be amewo léa tagbɔdɔ bɔbɔe hã.
Besides being a precursor to type 2 diabetes, it has recently been linked to an increased risk of dementia.
Ne èkpe fũu akpa, mewɔa dɔ sesẽ o, alo suklidɔ le wò ƒometɔ aɖewo ŋu la, ate ŋu anɔ eme be sukli sɔ gbɔ ɖe lã me na wò xoxo.
If you are overweight, not physically active, or have a family history of diabetes, you might already have prediabetes.
Anyo be nàna woado wò ʋu kpɔ.
A blood test can tell you if you do.
Nɔ Nuɖuɖu Nyuiwo Ðum.
Choose healthful food.
Aɖaŋuɖoɖo si gbɔna dzi wɔwɔ aɖe vi na wò ne èwɔ edzi ɣesiaɣi si wòanya wɔ: Ðe nu si nèɖuna la dzi kpɔtɔ wòanɔ ʋɛ wu.
You might benefit from doing the following whenever it is possible and practical: Eat smaller portions than usual.
No tsi, tii kple kɔfi le esi teƒe be nànɔ aha viviwo nom.
Instead of sugary fruit juice and carbonated beverages, drink water, tea, or coffee.
Ðu abolo siwo wotsɔ nuku blibowo wɔ kple mɔli, ɖu makaroni ʋɛ aɖe ko, eye nàƒo asa na nuɖuɖu siwo ŋu wotrɔ asi le fũu.
Eat whole-grain bread, rice, and pasta in moderation rather than refined foods.
Ðu lã siwo me ami menɔna fũu o, tɔmelã, ne kple ayi ƒomeviwo.
Eat leaner meats, fish, nuts, and beans.
Amagbe siwo me nunyiamewo le; 2.
A healthy salad; 2.
Ame aɖe le eɖokui dam kpɔ
Measuring a person’s weight on a scale
Nɔ kame dem.
Stay physically active.
Kamedede ate ŋu ana sukli ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ si le ʋu me na wò la naɖiɖi akpɔtɔ eye wòana makpe wu ale si dze o.
Exercise can lower your blood sugar and help you maintain a healthy weight.
Numekula aɖe ɖo aɖaŋu be woazã ɣeyiɣi siwo wotsɔ kpɔa television la ƒe akpa aɖe atsɔ ade kame.
Swap some TV time for exercise time, recommends one expert.
Màte ŋu atrɔ wò lãmenugbagbeviwo o, gake àte ŋu atrɔ ale si nènɔa agbee.
You cannot change your genes, but you can change your lifestyle.
Nu siwo ana míanɔ lãmesẽ me wu wɔwɔ aɖe vi na mí.
Doing what we can to improve our health is worth the effort.
"Metso Ðe Eŋu Kaba! "
‘I Took Action!’
Gbebiame
An Interview
Aleke nèwɔ nya be yeate ŋu alé suklidɔ bɔbɔe?
How did you realize that you were in danger of developing diabetes?
Esi menɔ dɔ yeye dim la, mena ɖɔkta aɖe dom kpɔ, eye wògblɔ nam be ne nyemedi nane wɔ kaba o la mele suklidɔ lé ge.
When I had a medical checkup for a new job, the doctor told me that I would soon be diabetic if I didn’t take urgent action.
Nu ene aɖewoe na be mate ŋu alé dɔ sia bɔbɔe: dɔ sia bɔ ɖe to si me tɔ menye la me tɔwo dome, nye ƒometɔ aɖewo lé dɔ sia, mekpe fũu akpa, eye nyemedea kame hã o.
I had four factors against me: I was from a high-risk ethnic group, I had a family history of diabetes, I was overweight, and I didn’t exercise.
Esi wònye be nyemate ŋu atrɔ nu eve gbãtɔawo o ta la, meɖoe be matrɔ eve mamlɛawo ya.
Since I couldn’t change the first two factors, I decided to try to change the last two.
Nu Kae Nèwɔ?
What did you do?
Meyi ɖɔkta aɖe si ɖoa aɖaŋu tso suklidɔ ŋu la gbɔ, eye wòɖe kadodo si le nuɖuɖu, kamedede, ame ƒe kpekpeme kple suklidɔ dome la me nam nyuie.
I went to a diabetes counselor who explained the relationship between diet, exercise, body weight, and diabetes.
Meɖoe be matrɔ asi le ale si menɔa agbee ŋu.
I determined to change my lifestyle.
Meɖua amagbewo hafi ɖua nu susɔeawo.
I began eating two portions of vegetables before the rest of my meal.
Esia nana be meɖia ƒo hafi va ɖua nuɖuɖu kpekpe siwo medea ame ƒe lãmesẽ dzi abe amagbewo ene o la.
That made me less hungry for the less healthful items on my plate.
Medea kame edziedzi, nu si medzudzɔ ƒe geɖee nye esi va yi.
I also became more physically active, something I had neglected for years.
Ðe Nèkpɔ Dzidzedzea?
How successful were you?
Le ɣleti 18 me la, nye kpekpeme dzi ɖe kpɔtɔ abe teƒe ɖeka le ewo me ene, eye wòdzɔ dzi nam kaka.
Within 18 months, I lost a tenth of my body weight, and I feel great.
Meɖoe kplikpaa be nyemaganɔ abe tsã ene o.
I’m determined not to return to my unhealthy habits.
Suklidɔ menye nu woafe kpli o!
Diabetes is definitely not to be taken lightly!
Nu Si Wòle Be Nànya Tso Kpeŋuidɔ Ŋu
What You Should Know About Epilepsy
WÒ AME nyanyɛ aɖe dze anyi hebu ɖe eɖokui.
AN ACQUAINTANCE falls to the ground, unconscious.
Ametia lia goŋgoŋ eye eƒe ta, asiwo kple afɔwo le ƒoƒom tititi.
His body stiffens, and his head and limbs begin to convulse.
Ne ènya be kpeŋuidɔ, si wogayɔna be dzeanyigblo alo adzigbo le eŋu la, àte ŋu ana kpekpeɖeŋu si sɔ lae hafi anɔ mɔ kpɔm na dɔdalawo ƒe kpekpeɖeŋu.
If you know that the person suffers from epilepsy, you can provide adequate assistance while waiting for help.
Na míakpɔ nyateƒenya siwo ku ɖe dɔléle sia si gɔme ame geɖewo mesena o la ŋu.
Let us explore some basic facts about this often misunderstood disorder.
Nu kae nye kpeŋuidɔ?
What is epilepsy?
Kpeŋuidɔ nye ahɔhɔ̃medɔ si nana ame buna ɖe eɖokui hena ɣeyiɣi kpui aɖe.
Epilepsy is a brain disorder that produces brief attacks called seizures.
Zi geɖe ne edze ame dzi la, medea miniti atɔ̃ hafi amea gagbugbɔna ɖoa eɖokui me o.
The entire seizure usually lasts less than five minutes.
Nudzɔdzɔ si míeɖɔ le nyati sia ƒe gɔmedzedze lae woyɔna zi geɖe be dzeanyigblo, elabe enana amea dzea anyi.
The situation described at the outset of this article is typical of what is called a grand mal seizure.
Nu kae nana dɔ sia hona na ame?
What causes seizures?
Numekulawo xɔe se be ahɔhɔ̃mekawo ƒe dɔmawɔmawɔ nyuie gbɔe wòtsona.
Researchers believe that seizures occur when there is an abnormal surge of electrical activity between brain cells.
Gake nu si nana ahɔhɔ̃mekawo doa kpo dɔwɔwɔ nyuie gɔme sese zu taɖui na numekulawo.
Just why this happens remains unclear.
Ne kpeŋuidɔ ho na ame aɖe la, kpekpeɖeŋu kae mate ŋu anae?
If I see someone with epilepsy having a grand mal seizure, what should I do?
Numekugbalẽ aɖe ɖo aɖaŋu be "ele be woaɖe asi le ame si ku kpeŋui la ŋu wòanɔ anyi ʋuu eƒe mo nakɔ, gake ahiã be woakpɔ egbɔ be ele gbɔgbɔm nyuie eye ŋku nanɔ eŋu be wòagawɔ nu vevi eɖokui o. "

"Bystanders should let the attack run its course and not interfere with the patient, beyond checking to make sure the person is in no physical danger and can breathe, " says The Encyclopedia of the Brain and Brain Disorders.

(The Encyclopedia of the Brain and Brain Disorders) Agbalẽ ma ke gblɔ yi edzi be: "Nenye be amea bu ɖe eɖokui wògbɔ miniti atɔ̃ ŋu, alo kasia eƒe mo nakɔ ko bubu gadze edzi alo megbugbɔ ɖo eɖokui me o miniti ʋɛ aɖewo esime wòdzudzɔ ƒoƒo tititi megbe la, ele be woadi dɔnɔkɔʋu ne wòakɔe ayi kɔdzi. "

On the other hand, the book says: "An ambulance should be called if the seizure continues for more than five minutes, if another seizure immediately follows the first, or if the person does not regain consciousness a few minutes after the seizure ends. "
Aleke mate ŋu akpe ɖe ame si ku kpeŋui la ŋu?
How can I help the patient while he is having a seizure?
Tsɔ nu bɔbɔe aɖe de eƒe ta te, eye nàɖe lãnuwo ɖa le eƒe ta gbɔ.
Place a soft object between his head and the floor, and move sharp objects away from his head.
Ne edzudzɔ ƒoƒo tititi la, trɔe ɖe eƒe axa dzi abe ale si wòdze le nɔnɔmetata si le axa sia me ene.
When the convulsions stop, turn the patient on his side as shown in the accompanying diagram.
Nu kae mawɔ ne amea ƒe mo kɔ?
What should I do after the patient awakens?
Gbã la, gblɔ nɛ be megavɔ̃ o.
First, assure him that everything is all right.
Azɔ lée tsi tre eye nàkplɔe ayi afi si wòate ŋu aɖi ɖe eme le.
Then help him to stand upright and guide him to a place where he can get needed rest.
Ame akpa gãtɔ tɔtɔna eye alɔ̃ tsɔa wo ne woɖo wo ɖokui me; gake ame aɖewo ya ƒe mo kɔna kaba eye wogatea ŋu yia nu si wɔm wole hafi ku kpeŋuia la wɔwɔ dzi.
Most people are confused and sleepy after a seizure; others recover quickly and can continue what they were doing before the attack.
Kpeŋuikulawo katãe ƒona tititia?
Do all epileptic seizures include convulsions?
Ao.
No.
Ame aɖewo buna ɖe wo ɖokui sẽe, gake womedzea anyi o.
Some patients experience a moment of impaired awareness without even falling to the ground.
Kpeŋui sia ƒomevi menɔa anyi eteƒe didina o, ne kpeŋuia nu tso na amea ko la eƒe mo kɔna zi ɖeka.
This is called a petit mal seizure (or absence seizure), which is usually brief with no lingering aftereffects.
Gake kpeŋui sia ƒomevi kula aɖewo ƒe kpeŋuikukua nɔa anyi eteƒe didina, eye wòxɔa miniti geɖewo.
Some people with epilepsy undergo prolonged petit mal seizures, lasting several minutes.
Ne edzɔ alea la, amea nɔa tsatsam le eƒe xɔ me, nɔa awu hem le eɖokui ŋu, alo nɔa nu tramatrama wɔm.
In such a case, the patient may wander around the room, tug at his clothing, or otherwise behave strangely.
Ne eƒe mo kɔ la, esena le eɖokui me be yeƒe ta katã le wodzoe.
After the seizure, he may feel light-headed.
Aleke agbea nɔna na ame si ŋu kpeŋuidɔ le?
What is it like to live with epilepsy?
Enye nyateƒe be ame siwo ŋu kpeŋuidɔ le la tsia dzi vevie esi womenya ɣekaɣi dɔ sia agaho na yewo o ta.
Understandably, many people with epilepsy contend with a nagging fear of when and where the next seizure will occur.
Esi womedi be yewoado ŋukpe yewo ɖokui o ta la, womelɔ̃na be yewoayi ame dome o.
To avoid embarrassment, they may tend to avoid social situations.
Aleke mate ŋu akpe ɖe ame si ŋu kpeŋuidɔ le la ŋu?
How can I give support to someone who has epilepsy?
De dzi ƒo nɛ be wòaɖe eƒe seselelãmewo agblɔ na ye faa.
Encourage him not to bottle up his feelings.
Ðo to nyuie ne ele nu ƒom.
Be a good listener.
Biae be ne dɔa ho nɛ la, kpekpeɖeŋu kae yeate ŋu anae mahã.
Ask him what he would like you to do if he has a seizure.
Esi wònye ame siwo ŋu kpeŋuidɔ le dometɔ geɖe mekua ʋu o ta la, àte ŋu adoe ɖa be yeakɔe ɖe ʋu me ayi afi si wòadi be yeayi alo ayi aɖaƒle asi nɛ.
Since many people with epilepsy do not drive, perhaps you could offer a ride or run some errands for him.
Ðe woate ŋu alé kpeŋuidɔ ƒe hoho na ame nu alo axe mɔ ɖe enu kura?
Can seizures be reduced or even prevented?
Nɔnɔme aɖewo nana be kpeŋuidɔ tea ŋu hona na ame kabakaba, esiawo dometɔ aɖewoe nye nuteɖeamedzi kple alɔ̃madɔmadɔ.
Some factors increase the likelihood of a seizure, such as stress and lack of sleep.
Dɔléle sia ŋuti nunyalawo dea dzi ƒo na ame siwo ŋu dɔ sia le la be woaɖi ɖe eme nyuie, eye woanɔ kame dem edziedzi ale be nu naganɔ tetem ɖe wo dzi boo o.
Experts therefore encourage epileptics to get proper rest and to exercise regularly in order to reduce stress.
Le go aɖewo me la, atike aɖewo zazã te ŋu xe mɔ ɖe dɔ sia ƒe hoho na ame nu kura.
In some cases, medications have also been effective in preventing seizures.
Esi wònye be kpeŋuidɔ le ɖekakpui Sello si le South Africa ŋu ta la, edzudzɔ sukudede le eƒe ɖevime.
Because of his epilepsy, a young man in South Africa named Sello was dismissed from school at an early age.
Esi wòtsi la, menya agbalẽ o, eye atike aɖeke hã mele esi wòtsɔ léa eƒe dɔlélea nu o.
He grew up without an education and without medication to control his epilepsy.
Gake edi be yeanya Biblia eye Yehowa Ðasefowo kpe ɖe eŋu.
But he wanted to understand the Bible, and Jehovah’s Witnesses helped him.
Wosrɔ̃ Biblia kplii eye wofia nuxexlẽ hãe.
They not only studied the Bible with him but also taught him to read.
Sello gblɔ be: "Yehowa Ðasefowo nye Kristotɔ siwo si lɔlɔ̃ akuakua le na wo haviwo. "
Additionally, a Witness medical doctor helped him get medication along with a social disability grant.
Fifia, Sello ŋutɔ hã zu Yehowa Ðasefo eye wòkpɔa dzidzɔ ɖe xexe yeye si ƒe ŋugbe Mawu do si me dɔléle maganɔ o la ŋu nya gbɔgblɔ na amewo ŋu.
"Jehovah’s Witnesses are truly loving Christians, " says Sello, who is now a Witness himself and enjoys sharing with others God’s promise of a new world where sickness will be no more.
Nyaɖeɖefia 21:3-5.
Revelation 21:3-5.
Nu Siwo Nàte Ŋu Awɔ
The Recovery Position
Esi wòdzudzɔ ƒoƒo tititi megbe . . .
After convulsing has stopped . . .
Dze klo ɖe dɔnɔa xa, eye lé eƒe abɔklugui nàtrɔ eƒe alɔ do ɖe eƒe ta gbɔ lɔƒo
Kneel beside the patient and bend his arm at the elbow, pointing it upward
He eƒe asi blewu ale be eƒe tome nanɔ eƒe asi dzi
Gently tuck the hand of the patient’s other arm underneath his cheek
Tsɔ asi evelia he amea ƒe klo va ɖokuiwò gbɔ, eye nàtrɔe blewu.
With your other hand, pull the patient’s knee toward you, slowly rolling him over.
He eƒe klo va ŋgɔ ale be eƒe klo nanɔ anyigba
Then move the patient’s knee in front of his body so that it rests on the floor
Trɔ eƒe ta yi dzi ale be gbɔgbɔ nagati eƒo o
Tilt the patient’s head up to allow for unobstructed breathing
Aɖulãdɔ Ele Fu Ðem Na Wòa?
Gum Disease Are You at Risk?
ENYE dɔléle siwo bɔ wu la dometɔ ɖeka.
IT IS one of the most common oral diseases in the world.
Ke hã dɔ sia menya kpɔna dzea si le gɔmedzedzea me o.
Yet, this disease in its initial stages may not cause any immediate symptoms.
Dɔléle vɔ̃ɖi si nye aɖulãdɔ míewɔnɛ.
This dangerous subtlety is characteristic of gum disease.
Agbalẽ aɖe gblɔ be aɖulãdɔ nye numedɔléle siwo "gblẽa nu le ame ƒe lãmesẽ ŋu vevie " la dometɔ ɖeka.
The International Dental Journal lists periodontal disease among oral disorders that pose "a serious public-health problem. "

(International Dental Journal) Agbalẽ ma ke gblɔ kpee be numedɔlélewo gblẽa nu geɖe le "ame ɖekaɖekawo kple amehaawo ŋu, wonana ame kpea fu hesea veve vevie, nuɖuɖu zua dɔ nɛ eye megasea vivi na agbea o. "
It adds that the impact of oral disease "on individuals and communities in terms of pain and suffering, impairment of function and reduced quality of life, is considerable. "
Numedzodzro tso dɔléle sia si ɖe kpe na ame geɖewo ŋu akpe ɖe ŋuwò nànya ale si nàwɔ aƒo asa nɛ.
A discussion of this widespread condition may help you reduce your risk of gum disease.
Nya Vevi Aɖewo Tso Aɖulãdɔ Ŋuti
Facts About Gum Disease
Aɖulãdɔ ƒe akpa vovovowoe li.
There are different stages of gum disease.
Le gɔmedzedzea la, enana aɖulãwo alo nyèdewo tena.
The initial stage, called gingivitis, is an inflammation of the gums.
Ne aɖulãwo toa ʋu la, ate ŋu anye aɖulãdɔ ƒe dzesie.
Bleeding gums may be a sign of this stage.
Esia tea ŋu dzɔna ne ame le nu me klɔm alo le aɖutɛ me ɖem, alo aɖulãwo ŋutɔ nanɔ anyi ko ato ʋu.
This may occur during brushing and flossing or for no apparent reason.
Ne aɖudɔdalawo le aɖua dom kpɔ ko wòto ʋu la, efia be aɖulãdɔ ƒe gɔmedzedzee nye ema.
Also, bleeding during a gum examination may be indicative of gingivitis. Gum disease that progresses from this stage is called periodontitis.
Ne aɖulãdɔ le tsitsim la, aɖuwo ƒe lãkusiwo kple aɖuŋuƒu siwo léa aɖuawo ɖe te la dome tea gbegblẽ.
At this point, oral structures that support your teeth, such as bone and gum tissue, begin to be destroyed.
Aɖulãdɔ sia menana dzesi aɖeke o va se ɖe esime wòtsi nyuie.
This form of gum disease may not cause symptoms until it reaches an advanced stage.

Ne aɖulãdɔ tsi va ɖo afi aɖe la, etea ŋu nana aɖulãwo tena ɖa le aɖuawo ŋu, aɖuawo gbɔdzɔna, eye wo dome kena, enana ame ƒe nu me ʋẽna, aɖulã alo nyèdewo nɔa nyinyim henana aɖuawo dzena abe ɖe wodidi ŋutɔ ene, eye aɖulãwo nɔa ʋu tom.

Some signs of periodontitis may be gum pockets; loose teeth; gaps forming between teeth; bad breath; receding gums, that is, gums that are pulling away from the teeth, giving the teeth a longer appearance; and bleeding gums.
Nu geɖewo gbɔe aɖulãdɔ tsona.
Cause and Effect of Gum Disease
Aɖuawo tea ŋu ƒoa sogo alo ƒoa ba.
Several factors can increase the risk of gum disease.
Sogo alo aɖuŋuba, si nye nugbagbevi nyaŋuinyaŋui siwo léna ɖe aɖuwo ŋu edziedzi gbɔ koŋue dɔ sia tsona.
Dental plaque, which is a thin film of bacteria that regularly forms on the teeth, is the most common cause.
Ne womeɖe sogoawo ɖa le aɖuawo ŋu o la, woate ŋu ana aɖulãawo nate.
If plaque is not removed, the bacteria can cause gum swelling.
Le ɣeyiɣi aɖe megbe la, aɖulãawo va nɔa tetem ɖa le aɖuawo ŋu si nana be mɔ va tsia aɖuawo kple aɖulãawo dome.
As this process progresses, the gums start to separate from the teeth, allowing the bacteria-laden plaque to grow under the gum line.
Eye sogoawo va ɖoa wo dome. Ne sogoawo nya ɖo wo dome ko la, wotea lãkusiawo kple aɖuŋuƒuawo dome gbegblẽ.
Once the bacteria has infiltrated to this point, the inflammatory process advances by destroying bone and gum tissue.
Eɖanye aɖuawo ŋue sogoawo le loo alo wo domee wole o, wotea ŋu va sesẽna ŋutɔ.
Dental plaque, either above or below the gum line, can harden into calculus (or what is commonly known as tartar).
Nugbagbevi nyaŋuinyaŋuiwo tsyɔa sogo sesẽ siawo hã dzi, eye esi wònye sogo siawo léna ɖe aɖuawo ŋu kpaɖii ta la, wo ɖeɖe le aɖuawo ŋu zua dɔ.
Calculus is also covered with bacteria, and because of its hardness and adherence to the teeth, it is not as easily removed as plaque.
Esia ate ŋu awɔe be nugbagbevi siawo nayi edzi agblẽ nu le aɖulãawo ŋu vevie.
Therefore, bacteria can continue to affect the gums adversely.
Aɖulãdɔ tea ŋu tsoa nu bubuwo hã gbɔ.
There are other factors that can contribute to your risk of having gum disease.

Nu siwo gbɔ wòtsona dometɔ aɖewo ate ŋu anye bemalémale na ame ƒe nu me, atike siwo tsia dɔlélenutsiŋutete ƒe dɔwɔwɔ nu, dɔlékuiwo, nuteɖeamedzi, suklidɔ (alo aɖuɖɔvividɔ) si ŋu womele ŋku lém ɖo o, aha tsu nono kple sigarɛtnono kpakple lãmetsiwo ƒe tɔtrɔ si fufɔfɔ hena vɛ.

These may include poor oral hygiene, medications that suppress the immune system, viral infections, stress, uncontrolled diabetes, excessive alcohol consumption, tobacco use, and hormonal changes because of pregnancy.
Aɖulãdɔ ate ŋu agblẽ nu le ŋuwò le go bubuwo hã me.
The effects of gum disease can have other implications for you.
Ate ŋu ana be nànɔ veve sẽm le nu me alo wò aɖuwo natu, si awɔe be màte ŋu aɖo aɖu nuɖuɖu dzi ahase vivi nɛ o.
A painful mouth or the loss of teeth from gum disease can hinder your ability to chew your food and enjoy it.
Ate ŋu agblẽ nu le wò nuƒoƒo kple wò mo ƒe dzedzeme hã ŋu.
Your speech and appearance may suffer.
Numekuku ɖee fia hã be ne ame ƒe nu me le dedie la, ekpɔa ŋusẽ ɖe ameti bliboa ƒe lãmesẽ dzi.
Also, research has shown that oral health is closely related to overall health.
Dzesidede Dɔa Kple Edada
Diagnosis and Treatment of Gum Disease
Aleke nàwɔ anya be aɖulãdɔ le ye ŋu?
How do you know if you have gum disease?
Ðewohĩ àkpɔ eƒe dzesi siwo ŋu míeƒo nu tsoe le nyati sia me la le ɖokuiwò ŋu.
You may notice some of the signs already mentioned in this article.
Ne èkpɔ dzesi siawo dometɔ aɖe la, ekema anyo be nàna aɖudɔdala bibi aɖe nalé ŋku ɖe wò aɖulãwo ŋu ahakpɔe ɖa be aɖulãdɔe hã.
If you do, it may be wise to consult a qualified dental professional who can assess the health of your gums.
Ðe woate ŋu ada aɖulãdɔa?
Is gum disease treatable?
Woate ŋu adae ne edze egɔme teti.
In its early stages, gum disease may be reversed.
Gake ne eva tsi la, nu si woate ŋu awɔ koe nye be woalé enu ale be magagblẽ aɖuŋuƒuwo kple eƒe lãkusiawo o.
If gum disease progresses to the point of periodontitis, then the goal is to halt the progress of the disease before it continues to destroy the bone and tissue that surround the teeth.
Aɖudɔdalawo zãa dɔwɔnu deŋgɔ siwo ate ŋu aɖe sogoawo kple nugbagbevi nyaŋuinyaŋui siwo le aɖua ƒe aɖulãwo ŋu kple esiwo le etome hã.
Dental professionals use specialized tools that can remove plaque and calculus from your teeth, both above and below the gum line.
Ne ŋutete mele ŋuwò alo aɖudɔdala bibiwo mele miaƒe nutoa me akpɔ gbɔwò o hã la, nu vevitɔ si nàte ŋu awɔe nye be nàƒo asa na dɔléle vɔ̃ɖi sia si menya kpɔna dzea si bɔbɔe o.
Even if you have limited or no access to professional dental care, the key to reducing your risk of this subtle yet potentially destructive disease is prevention.
Beléle nyuie na wò nu me edziedzie ana nàƒo asa na aɖulãdɔ.
Proper and regular oral self-care is the best prevention to reduce the risk of gum disease.
LÉ BE NA WÒ NU ME
ORAL HYGIENE
Nyɔnu aɖe le nu me klɔm
A woman brushing her teeth
Klɔ nu me zi eve ya teti gbe sia gbe.
Brush at least twice a day.
Ahiã be ame aɖewo ya naklɔ nu me edziedzi, ɖewohĩ ne woɖu nu vɔ megbe be woate ŋu aƒo asa na aɖulãdɔ
Some may need to brush more frequently, perhaps after each meal, in order to reduce the risk of gum disease
Zã brɔs si bɔbɔ, eye nàtutu aɖuawo ŋu blewuu
Use a brush with soft bristles, combined with gentle, short strokes
Nyɔnu aɖe le nu me klɔm
A woman cleaning between her teeth
Zã aɖutɛmeɖenu nàtsɔ anɔ aɖutɛ me ɖem blewuu gbe sia gbe, eye ne ehiã la zã brɔs alo aɖutɛmeɖenu siwo ŋu wotrɔ asi le etɔxɛe nàtsɔ awɔ esiae
Gently floss daily, using either dental floss or, if necessary, a device, such as a specially designed brush or a toothpick that cleans between the teeth
Nuɖuɖu Siwo Nana Ame Dzea Dɔ Kple Nuɖuɖu Siwo Ðea Fu Na Ame Vovototo Kae Le Wo Dome?
Food Allergy and Food Intolerance​ What’s the Difference?
Emily: "Esi mekpɔe be nye lãme menɔ wɔwɔm nyuie o la, meda gafloa ɖi.
Emily: "I put down my fork and started to feel uneasy.
Nu me tem fiefie eye nye aɖe nɔ tetem.
I had an itchy sensation in my mouth, and my tongue was swelling.
Nye mo nɔ tɔtrɔm eye gbɔgbɔ zu dɔ nam.
I started to feel light-headed and was having trouble breathing.
Nutsetsewo do ɖe nye abɔwo kple nye kɔ ŋu.
Hives were breaking out on my arms and neck.
Medi be malé ɖokuinye kpoo gake ele be mawɔ kaba ayi kɔdzi! "
I tried to stifle panic but knew I had to get to a hospital​ and quickly! "
LE AME akpa gãtɔ gome la dzidzɔe nuɖuɖu nye na wo.
FOR most people, eating is a pleasant experience.
Gake le ame aɖewo hã gome la, enye dzizizi na wo be woabu nuɖuɖu aɖewo be wonye yewoƒe "futɔwo. "
There are some, however, who are compelled to treat certain foods as "enemies. "
Le ame siawo gome la, nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana wodzea dɔ abe Emily si ƒe nya míegblɔ va yi ene.
Like Emily, quoted earlier, they suffer from food allergies.
Le ale si Emily tɔa nu sẽe la ate ŋu ana wòaku gɔ̃ hã.
Emily’s severe allergic response is called anaphylaxis, a very dangerous condition.
Dzidzɔtɔe la, ame akpa gãtɔ tɔ nu mesẽ nenema gbegbe o.
Thankfully, most food allergies are not as serious.
Le ŋkeke siawo me la, ame siwo nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana wodzea dɔ kple ame siwo nuɖuɖu aɖewo ɖea fu na la le dzidzim ɖe edzi.
In recent years, there has been a rise in reported food allergies and intolerances.
Ke hã numekukuwo fia be togbɔ be ame geɖe gblɔna be nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana yewodzea dɔ hã la, wova de dzesii be wo dometɔ ʋɛ aɖewo ŋu koe kuxi sia le.
Some studies, however, suggest that only a small portion of those who think they have a food allergy have been definitely diagnosed.
Nuɖuɖu Siwo Nana Ame Dzea Dɔ
What Is a Food Allergy?
Le dzɔdzɔmeŋutinunyala aɖewo siwo aƒenɔ Jennifer J. Schneider Chafen nɔ ŋgɔ na ƒe nya siwo wota ɖe magazine aɖe me nu la, "ame sia ame kple nuɖuɖu siwo nana wòdzea dɔ. "

"Food allergy has no universally accepted definition, " according to a group of scientists led by Dr. Jennifer J. Schneider Chafen in their report published in The Journal of the American Medical Association.
(The Journal of the American Medical Association) Ke hã, eŋunyala geɖewo gblɔ be lãmenu siwo kpɔa míaƒe lãmesẽ ta koŋ gbɔe wòtsona be nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana míedzea dɔ.
However, most experts believe that allergic reactions are primarily triggered by the immune system.
Zi geɖe la, nunyiame si nye protein (protéine) si le nuɖuɖu aɖewo me ye nana ame aɖewo dzea dɔ.
An allergic reaction to a certain food is typically a response to a protein in that food.
Lãmenu siwo kpɔa míaƒe lãmesẽ ta dea dzesi protein la vodadatɔe be enye nu si agblẽ nu le ame ŋu.
The immune system erroneously identifies that protein as harmful.
Ne protein ƒomevi aɖe ge ɖe amea ƒe lãme la, lãmenu siwo kpɔa míaƒe lãmesẽ ta dzia dɔlékuiwunu si nye IgE be wòawɔ avu kplii.
When a particular protein enters the body, the immune system may create a type of antibody known as IgE to neutralize the perceived invader.
Nenye be amea gaɖu nuɖuɖu ma ke la dɔlékuiwunu (IgE) si le lãme na amea xoxo la gadzia lãmetsi bubuwo siwo dome histamine (l’histamine) hã le kpenɛ.
When the food allergen is again ingested, the antibodies that were created earlier can trigger a release of chemicals, including histamine.
Le nyateƒe me la histamine wɔa akpa vevi aɖe be míenɔa lãmesẽ me.
Under normal circumstances, histamine plays a beneficial role in the immune system.
Gake ɖe susu aɖewo siwo mele nyanya o ta la, lãmetsi siwo nye IgE kple histamine dzidzi ɖe lãme na ame aɖewo siwo nuɖuɖu aɖewo menyo na o nana wodzea dɔ.

But for reasons not clearly understood, the presence of IgE antibodies and the subsequent release of histamine provoke an allergic reaction in people who happen to be hypersensitive to a particular food protein.
Esia tae ne èɖu nuɖuɖu aɖe si menyo na wò o zi gbãtɔ la, naneke madzɔ ɖe dziwò o, gake ne ègaɖui ɣebubuɣi la, àdze dɔ.
This explains why you could eat a new food without any apparent reaction but eat the same food again and experience an allergic reaction.
Nuɖuɖu Siwo Ðea Fu Na Ame
What Is Food Intolerance?
Abe nuɖuɖu siwo nana ame dzea dɔ ene la, nuɖuɖu siwo ɖea fu na ame hã li.
A food intolerance, like a food allergy, may be an adverse reaction to a food item.
Lãmenu siwo kpɔa míaƒe lãmesẽ ta gbɔe wòtsona be nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana ame dzea dɔ gake le nuɖuɖu aɖewo siwo ɖea fu na ame ya gome la lãmenu siwo tua nu siwo míeɖuna gbɔe wòtsona.
But unlike a food allergy (which is triggered directly by the immune system), a food intolerance is a reaction of the digestive system, and thus no antibodies are involved.
Zi geɖe la, esesẽna na dɔgboa be wòatu nuɖuɖua le esi lãmetsi siwo wɔa dɔ sia mesɔ gbɔ o ta alo be esesẽna na dɔgboa be wòatu nunyiame aɖe si le nuɖuɖua me.
Basically, a person may have trouble breaking down a food, perhaps because of enzyme deficiencies or because of chemicals found in the food that are difficult to process.
Le kpɔɖeŋu me, lactose si nye sukli si le nyinotsi me la ɖea fu na ame ne amea ƒe dɔmenuwo medzi lãmetsi geɖe be woatu suklia ahawɔ eŋu dɔ o.
For example, a lactose intolerance occurs when the gut does not produce the needed enzymes to digest the type of sugars found in milk products.
Le nuɖuɖu siwo ɖea fu na ame ya gome la, ne ame nya ɖu nua zi gbãtɔ ko la ade dzesi eƒe fuɖename enumake.
As it is not a matter of the production of antibodies, a food intolerance can manifest itself the first time the food is ingested.
Ðewohĩ nuɖuɖu siwo ɖea fu na ame la ƒe agbɔsɔsɔ si amea ɖu gbɔe wòatso be wòaɖe fu nɛ.
Quantity may be the determining factor​ a small amount of a certain food may be tolerated, but a problem may occur when larger amounts are ingested.
Ne eɖu nuɖuɖu mawo ƒe ʋɛ aɖewo ko la ɖewohĩ maɖe fu nɛ o, gake ne eɖui wòsɔ gbɔ la aɖe fu nɛ.
This is different from severe food allergies in which even a tiny amount of food can cause a life-threatening reaction.
Nyinotsi, koklozi, bɔlu, soya, tɔmelã, azi, azi siwo tsena ɖe ati dzi kple lu
Milk, eggs, crustaceans, soybeans, fish, peanuts, tree nuts, and wheat
Dzesiawo
What Are the Symptoms?

Ne èɖu nane eye ŋuti te wò fiefie, klabi do ɖe ŋuwò, wò veme, ŋkuwo kple wò aɖe te, dzigbɔ le tsɔwòm, èle tutrum, èŋɔ mĩ, eye vɔ̃ɖitɔ wue nye be ɖewohĩ eho ʋusɔgbɔdɔ na wò, wò mo le zi tsɔm, nèyi ɖi me, alo dzidɔ dze dziwò la, ekema efia be ɖewohĩ nuɖuɖu ma le esiwo nana nèdzea dɔ la dome.

If you suffer from a food allergy, you could have itching; hives; swelling of the throat, eyes, or tongue; nausea; vomiting; or diarrhea. And in a worst-case scenario, you could have a drop in blood pressure, dizziness, fainting, and even cardiac arrest.
Wo dometɔ aɖewo nu ate ŋu asesẽ ale gbegbe be wòawu ame.
An anaphylactic reaction can progress rapidly and be fatal.
Nuɖuɖu ɖe sia ɖe kloe ate ŋu ana ame nadze dɔ.
Potentially, any food could cause an allergy.
Ke hã, nuɖuɖu ʋɛ aɖewo koe nana ame dzea dɔ vevie. Woawoe nye: nyinotsi, koklo kple xewo ƒe aziwo, tɔmelã, agalã kple bɔlu, ayi si nye soya (soja) azi siwo tsena ɖe atiwo dzi kple lu.
However, the most severe food allergies are commonly caused by just a few foods: namely, milk, eggs, fish, crustaceans, peanuts, soybeans, tree nuts, and wheat.
Nuɖuɖu aɖewo ate ŋu ana ƒe ɖe sia ɖe xɔla nadze dɔ.
A person can develop an allergy at any age.
Numekukuwo fia be woate ŋu anyi edome tso ame dzilawo gbɔ bɔbɔe vevietɔ nenye be nuɖuɖu aɖewo nana dzila ɖeka alo evea siaa dzea dɔ.
Studies show that genetics play an important role, and a child is more likely to develop an allergy if one or both of his parents have allergies.
Zi geɖe la, ne ɖevi aɖewo tsi la, nuɖuɖu aɖewo siwo nana wodzea dɔ la megaɖea fu na wo o.
It is not uncommon for children to grow out of allergies.
Dzesi siwo fiana be nuɖuɖu aɖe ɖea fu na ame la nu mesẽna de dzesi siwo fiana be nuɖuɖu aɖe nana ame dzea dɔ la nu o.
Symptoms of food intolerance are generally less alarming than those of extreme allergic reactions.
Ne nuɖuɖu aɖe ɖea fu na ame la, ate ŋu ana dɔme naɖu ame, ƒodo nadzi ɖe ame ŋu, ame nanɔ ŋɔ nyem, dɔme nanɔ elém, ta nanɔ eɖum, nutsetsewo nado ɖe eŋu, ɖeɖi nate eŋu alo ame natsi mavomavo.
Food intolerance may cause stomach pain, bloating, gas, cramps, headaches, skin rash, tiredness, or a general feeling of malaise.
Nuɖuɖu siwo ate ŋu aɖe fu na ame dometɔ aɖewo nye nyinotsi kple nyinotsi babla, lu kple ƒo ƒomevi aɖewo, aha sesẽwo kple nu siwo me amɔwɔʋãnu le.
An intolerance may be related to a variety of foods​ dairy, wheat, gluten, alcohol, and yeast are among the most common.
Ale Si Nàwɔ Anya Kple Ale Si Nàwɔ Adae
Diagnosis and Treatment
Ne èsusu be nuɖuɖu siwo nana ame dzea dɔ alo nuɖuɖu siwo ɖea fu na ame nye kuxi le ye ŋu la, ɖewohĩ àte ŋu ayi kɔdzi be ɖɔkta si nya nu tso eŋu la nado wò kpɔ.
If you think you may suffer from a food allergy or a food intolerance, you may decide to get checked by a specialized health professional.
Ne wò ŋutɔ nèdzudzɔ nanewo ɖuɖu le esi nèsusu be woawo gbɔe yeƒe kuxia tso la, awɔe be nàte nunyiame vevi aɖewo siwo wò ametia hiã la ɖokuiwò le manyamanya me.
Self-diagnosis and autonomously deciding to eliminate certain foods can at times be harmful, as you may inadvertently deprive your body of necessary nutrients.
