An appendix explains such topics as the principles of Bible translation and the history of how the Bible was written and preserved.
Wona Mawu ƒe ŋkɔa dze le ƒe 1984 ƒe Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia me le teƒe 7,000 sɔŋ.
The 1984 edition of the New World Translation already included God’s personal name some 7,000 times in the text.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, Mawu ƒe ŋkɔa gadze le asinuŋɔŋlɔgbalẽ xoxotɔ kekeake siwo ŋu wova ke ɖo nyitsɔ laa ƒe akpa bubu aɖewo hã, eye wodee le akpa siawo hã le ƒe 2013 ƒe tata yeye sia me.
However, the 2013 revision also reflects current research on where the name of God appears in the oldest Bible manuscripts.

Elabena esi woku nu me tso Ƒukukua ƒe Agbalẽxatsaxatsawo kple asinuŋɔŋlɔgbalẽ xoxotɔwo me la, wokpɔe be Mawu ƒe ŋkɔa gadze le teƒe ade bubuwo, eye wodee teƒe mawo katã le Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia yeye sia me.
Based on further examination of the Dead Sea Scrolls and other ancient manuscripts, the revised New World Translation includes six additional occurrences of the divine name.
Wodze le Ʋɔnudrɔ̃lawo 19:18; 1 Samuel 2:25; 6:3; 10:26; 23:14, 16.
They are found at Judges 19:18; 1 Samuel 2:25; 6:3; 10:26; 23:14; 23:16.
Megbenyawo gaƒo nu tso ale si wozã Mawu ƒe ŋkɔa le blema Hebrigbe kple Helagbe me kpakple ale si wòdze le Biblia-gɔmeɖeɖe siwo le egbegbe gbegbɔgblɔ vovovowo mee me la ŋu.
An appendix further discusses the use of the divine name in ancient Hebrew and Greek, as well as its appearance in Bible translations in several modern dialects and languages.
Tso gbe aɖe gbe kee Ðasefowo ɖea Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia gɔme, tanɛ hemana na amewo, eye agbalẽnyalagãwo dea asixɔxɔ Biblia sia ŋu ŋutɔ ɖe ale si wòde pɛpɛpɛ ta.
The Witnesses have a long history of printing, distributing, and translating the New World Translation, which has been well-regarded by scholars for its accuracy.
Woɖe Biblia sia ƒe bliboa ɖe go zi gbãtɔ le ƒe 1961 me le Eŋlisigbe me.
The complete text of this translation was first made available in English in 1961.

Le ƒe 1963 me la, nyadzɔdzɔgbalẽ aɖe (The New York Times) ka nya ta be abe ale si woɖe gbeƒãe le Ðasefowo ƒe takpekpe si wowɔ le Yankee Stadium ene la, woaɖe Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia gɔme ɖe gbegbɔgblɔ ade bubuwo me.
In 1963, The New York Times reported that the New World Translation would be available in six additional languages, as announced at a Witness convention held at Yankee Stadium.
Tso ɣemaɣi la, Ðasefowo ta Biblia sia ɖe gbegbɔgblɔ 120 kple edzivɔwo me.
Since then, the Witnesses have provided this translation in over 120 languages.

Nyitsɔ laa la, Xexe Yeye Biblia Gɔmeɖeɖe Kɔmitia ɖoe be yeagbugbɔ asi trɔ le Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia ŋu ale be wòasɔ ɖe egbegbe Eŋlisigbe nu eye emenya aɖewo gɔme sese nanɔ bɔbɔe wu, ale be eme nakɔ eye exexlẽ nanɔ bɔbɔe wu.

In recent years, the New World Bible Translation Committee chose to revise the New World Translation to respond to changes in modern language and to clarify certain Biblical expressions, thus enhancing readability and understanding.
Eye alea tututue wotrɔ asi le eŋui.
The revised New World Translation embodies these latest advances in Bible translation.

Aƒetɔ J. R. Brown, si nye Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyanuɖela le woƒe dɔwɔƒegã la, gblɔ be: "Dzidzɔ gã aɖee wònye ɣemaɣi esi woxɔ Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia gbãtɔ ƒe 50 aɖewoe nye esi va yi, gake dzi dzɔ mí wu gbɔgblɔ esi míexɔ gɔmeɖeɖe yeye sia.

"It was thrilling to receive the first editions of the New World Translation over 50 years ago, and it is even more thrilling to have the latest revised edition, " states J. R. Brown, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses at their world headquarters.
Míaƒe taɖodzinue nye be míaɖe Ŋɔŋlɔ Kɔkɔeawo gɔme wo gɔme sese nanɔ bɔbɔe na ame sia ame, evɔ míazã nya siwo de pɛpɛpɛ, nya siwo ŋu bubu le siwo amewo zãna egbea le nuƒoƒo me. "
"Our intent is to make the Holy Scriptures understandable to all, using language that is accurate, dignified, and contemporary. "
Ale Si Nyaa Va Yii: Agbagba Si Wodze Be Woaxe Mɔ Ðe JW.ORG Nu Medze Edzi O
Expanded Coverage: Attempt to Ban JW.ORG Fails
ST.
ST.

PETERSBURG, Russia Yehowa Ðasefowo ɖu dzi gã aɖe le ʋɔnudrɔ̃nya aɖe me le January 22, 2014 dzi, esi nyagbugbɔdrɔ̃ƒea te fli ɖe nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe suetɔ ƒe nyametsotso be woaxe mɔ ɖe jw.org, si nye Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyatakakadzraɖoƒea nu le Russia-dukɔa me godoo.

PETERSBURG, Russia Jehovah’s Witnesses won a major court victory on January 22, 2014, when an appellate court reversed a lower court’s ruling that banned jw.org, the official website of Jehovah’s Witnesses, throughout Russia.
Tver Nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe te fli ɖe Tsentralniy nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe suetɔ ƒe nyametsotsoa me le August 7, 2013 dzi.
The Tver Regional Court overturned the August 7, 2013, decision of the Tsentralniy District Court.

Tver Nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea de dzesii be nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe suetɔa ƒe nyametsotso be woaxe mɔ ɖe Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyatakakadzraɖoƒea nu mele se nu o, elabena womeɖe mɔ na Yehowa Ðasefowo, ame siwo tɔ nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia nye la be woakpɔ ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃a teƒe o.
The regional court determined that the district court was unjustified in banning the website because Jehovah’s Witnesses, the owners, had not been given an opportunity to participate in the hearing.
Nutoa me ʋɔnudrɔ̃la amesamala si le Tver tsɔ nya ɖe jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒea ŋu be agbalẽ siwo Russia dziɖuɖua tso nya me be wodea "aglãdzedze ƒe dzi ƒo " la le edzi.
The local prosecutor in Tver brought the case to court because jw.org contained publications that Russian courts have ruled to be "extremist. "
Esi Yehowa Ðasefowo nya se nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe suetɔ ƒe nyametsotsoa ko la, woɖe agbalẽ siwo ŋu nyaa ku ɖo la le jw.org si amewo ʋuna le Russia la dzi.
As soon as Jehovah’s Witnesses learned of the district court’s ruling, they removed these publications from jw.org in Russia.
Tver Nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea ɖo kpe edzi be Ðasefoawo wɔ ɖe Russia ƒe sewo dzi eye wòte fli ɖe mɔxexe ɖe woƒe nyatakakadzraɖoƒea ƒe nyametsotsoa me.
The Tver Regional Court confirmed that the Witnesses were in compliance with Russian laws and rescinded the ban.

Yehowa Ðasefowo meda asi ɖe ale si Russia ƒe ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe aɖewo bua woƒe agbalẽ aɖewo be wodea "aglãdzedze ƒe dzi ƒo " la dzi o, eye woŋlɔ nutsotso geɖe yi Europa Amegbetɔ Ƒe Gomenɔamesiwo Ŋuti Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea be wòate fli ɖe ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒeawo ƒe nutsotsoawo me.

Jehovah’s Witnesses are contesting the rulings by the Russian courts that have declared some of their publications to be "extremist " and have submitted several applications to the European Court of Human Rights to reverse these decisions.

Aƒetɔ Grigory Martynov, si nye Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyanuɖela le Russia, gblɔ be: "Enye dzidzɔ na mí be ʋɔnudrɔ̃lawo kpɔ vi si gbegbe míaƒe nyatakakadzraɖoƒea ɖena na amewo kple agbagba gbogbo siwo míedze be míawɔ ɖe Russia ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒewo ƒe nyametsotsowo dzi la dze sii.

Grigory Martynov, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia, states: "We are pleased that the judges saw the benefits of our website and the reasonableness of our efforts to comply with Russian court decisions.
Míayi edzi aʋli míaƒe agbalẽwo ƒe vavãnyenye ta eye míaʋli gome si le Russiatɔwo si be Biblia-fiafiadɔ si wɔm míele naɖe vi na wo bliboe la hã ta. "
We will continue to defend the integrity of our publications and the rights of Russian citizens to benefit fully from our Bible education work. "
Aƒetɔ J. R. Brown si nye Ðasefoawo ƒe nyanuɖela le woƒe dɔwɔƒegã gblɔ be: "Dzi le Ðasefo siwo le xexea me godoo la dzɔm ɖe dziɖuɖu sia ta.
"Witnesses around the world are rejoicing at this victory, " states J. R. Brown, a spokesman at the Witnesses’ world headquarters.
Ale si míeɖu dzi le ʋɔnunya sia me na mɔnukpɔkpɔ Russiatɔwo katã be woayi edzi anɔ nyatakaka siwo le nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia la zãm faa. "
"Thanks to this legal victory, all citizens of Russia will continue to have access to this excellent Bible-education website. "
Nyatakaka Yeyewo: Yehowa Ðasefowo De Kpekpeɖeŋunaɖoɖo Aɖe To Me Esi Haiyan Ahom Dziŋɔ La Tu Megbe
Update: After Super Typhoon Haiyan, Jehovah’s Witnesses Mobilize Relief Effort

MANILA, Philippines Esi Haiyan Ahom la tu gblẽ nu ŋɔdzitɔe megbe la, Yehowa Ðasefowo tso kpla hede dukɔwo dome kpekpeɖeŋunana ƒe ɖoɖo aɖe to me hena kpekpe ɖe ame siwo ŋu ahom la gblẽ nu le le Philippines la ŋu.
MANILA, Philippines In response to the massive devastation caused by Super Typhoon Haiyan, Jehovah’s Witnesses have organized an ongoing global relief effort for the Philippines.
Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe alɔdzedɔwɔƒe si le Manila ɖo kpekpeɖeŋunakɔmiti atɔ̃ be woana kpekpeɖeŋu ame siwo ŋu ahom la gblẽ nu le.
The branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Manila formed five disaster relief committees to expedite assistance to victims.
Woɖo kpekpeɖeŋunanu tɔn 190 ɖe ame siwo le Philippines ƒe titinanutowo me.
More than 190 tons of supplies have been sent to the central Philippines.
Ne mede ɖeke o la, Ðasefo siwo tso dukɔ ewo me ya teti lɔ̃ faa be yewoava na kpekpeɖeŋu.
Witnesses from at least ten countries offered to assist with the relief effort.
Lɔlɔ̃nu faa dɔwɔla siawo le kpekpeɖeŋu nam be woatso aƒe 2,000 kple edzivɔwo eye wole kpekpeɖeŋu hã nam le atikewɔnyawo gome.
Volunteers are helping to rebuild and repair over 2,000 homes or provide medical support.
Ame siwo ade 225 sɔŋ gakpɔtɔ le avɔgbadɔ siwo Ðasefoawo tu ɖe teƒe si te ɖe Calbayog City ŋu le Samar me.
As many as 225 people are still living in tents set up by the Witnesses at a relocation site near Calbayog City, Samar.
Wobu akɔnta be ame siwo ʋu va le avɔgbadɔ siawo me la dometɔ 15 va se ɖe 20 le alafa me menye Ðasefowo o.
An estimated 15 to 20 percent of those seeking refuge at the site are non-Witnesses.
Esi ahom sia si wobu be enye ahom sesẽtɔ siwo tu kpɔ dometɔ ɖeka tu megbe la, ame siwo ku ƒe agbɔsɔsɔme va ɖo 6,201 eye womeke ɖe ame 1,785 ŋu o.
In the aftermath of what has proved to be one of the most powerful storms to ever make landfall, the death toll has risen to 6,201 and 1,785 people are still missing.
Ame 28,000 xɔ abi vevie eye aƒe miliɔn ɖeka kple edzivɔ dome gblẽ.
Some 28,000 people were injured and over 1 million homes were damaged.
Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe alɔdzedɔwɔƒe si le Philippines ka nya ta be Ðasefo 33 ku, wodi wo dometɔ 10 hã do kpoe, eye wobui be ɖe woku.
The Philippines branch office of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Manila now confirms that 33 Witnesses have died and 10 are missing and presumed dead.
Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe Dɔdzikpɔhaa me tɔ Mark Sanderson yi ɖakpɔ ame siwo dzi afɔkua dzɔ ɖo la ɖa.
Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses, visits disaster victims.
Tso December 7, 2013 dzi la, Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe Dɔdzikpɔhaa me tɔ Mark Sanderson yi ɖakpɔ ame siwo le nuto atɔ̃ siwo me ahom la gblẽ nu me la ɖa ŋkeke adre me sɔŋ.
Beginning on December 7, 2013, Mark Sanderson, a member of the Governing Body of Jehovah’s Witnesses, visited five provinces in the affected region over the course of seven days.

Egblɔ be: "Nu si ahom sia gblẽ la gakpɔtɔ le ŋusẽ gã aɖe kpɔm ɖe Philippinetɔ geɖewo dzi kokoko; ke hã míesɔ gbe be míayi edzi anɔ kpekpeɖeŋunanu siwo hiã ɖom ɖa, azã míaƒe ŋusẽ kple akɔfanyawo atsɔ akpe ɖe ame siwo ŋu ahom la gblẽ nu le la ŋu. "

He states: "The tragic results of Typhoon Haiyan are still deeply affecting many in the Philippines; yet we are prepared to continue providing the needed supplies, manpower, and comfort to help the victims recover. "
Russia Dziɖuɖumegãwo Di Be Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe Nana Ŋusẽ Yewo Yewoaɖo Asi Nyatakakadzraɖoƒe Xɔŋkɔ Aɖe Dzi
Russian Officials Seek Court Ruling to Ban Popular Bible-Education Website
ST.
ST.

PETERSBURG, Russia​ Le August 7, 2013 dzi la, Tsentralniy Nutomeʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe si le Tver-dua me tso nya me be woaɖo asi jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒe si dzi Biblia me nufiamewo nɔna la dzi le Russia-dukɔa me godoo. Tver-du sia le Moscow ƒe dziehe eye wòdidi tso egbɔ abe kilometa 160 ene.

PETERSBURG, Russia On August 7, 2013, the Tsentralniy District Court of the city of Tver, located 100 mi (approx. 160 km) north of Moscow, ruled that the Bible-education website jw.org should be banned throughout the Russian Federation.

Togbɔ be ame akpe alafa geɖewo zãa jw.org le xexea me godoo, eye numekula geɖewo kpɔa ŋudzedze ɖe nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia ŋu hã la, ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea de dziɖuɖua dzi eye wòbia be woaɖo asi nyatakakadzraɖoƒea dzi.
Although jw.org is consulted by hundreds of thousands around the world and is highly regarded by researchers, the court sided with officials seeking to ban the popular website.
Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea mena nyanya Gbetakpɔxɔ Biblia Kple Trakt Habɔbɔ si le New York si tɔe nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia nye loo alo se woƒe numenya aɖeke hafi tso nya me o.
The court rendered its decision without notifying or taking any testimony from the publishers of the site, the Watchtower Bible and Tract Society of New York.
Yehowa Ðasefowo bia tso Tver Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒegã si be woagbugbɔ nya la adrɔ̃ na yewo.
Jehovah’s Witnesses are appealing the decision to the Tver Regional Court.
Woda nyadɔdrɔ̃ sia ɖe January 22, 2014 dzi.
The appeal is scheduled to be heard on January 22, 2014.

Esia awɔe be nyatakakadzraɖoƒea zazã nabɔ Yehowa Ðasefo 160,000 kple edzivɔ siwo le dukɔa me siwo zãnɛ edziedzi tsɔ srɔ̃a Biblia le woƒe mawusubɔsubɔwɔnawo me, le woƒe ƒomewo me kple wo ɖokuiwo si la siaa.

If the appeal is denied, the website will no longer be available to the over 160,000 Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia, who regularly use the website for religious services and in personal and family Bible study.
Eye esia ana be woabu ame sia ame si ado boblo nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia le Russia la hã be enye nu vlo wɔla.
Promoting the website will then become a criminal act in Russia.
Gakpe ɖe eŋu la, esia awɔe be ame miliɔn 142 siwo le Russia-dukɔa me la hã magate ŋu azã jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒea, afi si woakpɔ Biblia me nufiamewo le femaxee la o.
Additionally, some 142 million people living in Russia will be restricted from consulting jw.org for free information about the Bible.

Xexemenunyalagã Yekaterina Elbakyan si nye mawusubɔsubɔnyawo ŋuti nunyala eye wòganye nufialagã le Dɔwɔwɔ Kple Hadomekadodowo Ƒe Suku le Moscow gblɔ tso jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒea ŋu be "nunana nyui aɖee wònye na ame sia ame si kua nu me tso mawusubɔsubɔnyawo ŋu.

Commenting on the website, Yekaterina Elbakyan, Doctor of Philosophy and expert in religious studies who serves as a professor at the Academy of Labor and Social Relations in Moscow, says that jw.org is "a gift for anybody who is engaged in religious research.
Nyatakaka gbogbo siwo gɔme sese le bɔbɔe la le edzi.
It provides comprehensive and understandable material.
Woɖe mawusubɔsubɔ kple agbe nyui nɔnɔ ƒe nya veviwo me le mɔ bɔbɔe nu.
Significant spiritual and moral issues are presented in a simple way.
Ne èzã nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia, ɖeko nàse le ɖokuiwò me abe Yehowa Ðasefo aɖee kpe wò va eƒe me ene. "
When you use the website, you feel like you are being openly welcomed into the home of Jehovah’s Witnesses. "

Aƒetɔ Grigory Martynov, si nye Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyanuɖela le Russia, gblɔ le St. Petersburg be: "Dɔwɔnu nyui aɖee jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒea nye na míaƒe dukɔa me tɔ siwo di be yewoanya nu tso Biblia ŋu, eye nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia medoa dunyahenyawo alo asitsanyawo ɖe ŋgɔ o.

Speaking from St. Petersburg, Grigory Martynov, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia, states: "The jw.org website is a wonderful tool for those in our country searching for information about the Bible and is not politically or commercially affiliated in any way.
Míele mɔ kpɔm be Tver Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒegã akpɔ egbɔ be womaxe mɔ ɖe nyatakakadzraɖoƒe nyui sia nu le Russia o. "
We hope that the Tver Regional Court will ensure that this popular educational resource remains available for all Russians. "

Aƒetɔ J. R. Brown, si nye Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe nyanuɖela le woƒe dɔwɔƒegã le New York, gblɔ be: "Amewo zãa jw.org nyatakakadzraɖoƒea tsɔ kua nu me eye ƒomewo le xexea me hã kpɔa nyatakaka ɖɔʋuwo le afi ma.

J. R. Brown, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses at their world headquarters in New York, comments: "The jw.org website is valued both as a research tool and as a trusted information source for families all over the world.
Eɖea vi na amewo ale gbegbe be gbe sia gbe kloe la, ame 900,000 ʋunɛ dia nyatakaka ɖɔʋu siwo le gbegbɔgblɔ siwo wu 600 me.
It is so valued that an average of 900,000 people visit the site every day to access positive information available in some 600 languages.
Asiɖoɖo nyatakakadzraɖoƒe sia dzi mele se nu o. "
Censoring this material is clearly unwarranted. "
Armenia Ðe Asi Le Ame Siwo Gbe Be Yewomawɔ Asrafodɔ O Le Dzitsinya Ta La Ŋu
Armenia Releases Conscientious Objectors
Le November 12, 2013 dzi la, Armenia-dukɔa ɖe asi le Yehowa Ðasefo siwo wolé de ga le esi wogbe be yewomawɔ asrafodɔ o le dzitsinya ta la ƒe mamlɛawo ŋu.
On November 12, 2013, Armenia released all remaining Jehovah’s Witnesses imprisoned for conscientious objection.
Àkpɔ ale si woɖe asi le Ðasefoawo ŋu le ʋɔnudɔdrɔ̃ ɖedzesi aɖe megbe la ƒe ŋutinya le video sia me.
This video outlines how a historic legal case culminated in the release of these Witnesses.
Tokunɔgbe Me Dɔwɔnu Yeye!
New Sign-Language App Available!
Àte ŋu azã JW Library Sign Language dɔwɔnu yeyea atsɔ awɔ tokunɔgbe me videowo ƒe kɔpi eye àte ŋu aƒo wo hã le jw.org.
The new app JW Library Sign Language allows you to download and play sign-language videos from jw.org.
Àte ŋu akpɔ video siawo ne mèle internet dzi o hã.
You can watch them even when you are not connected to the Internet.
Nɔnɔmetata nyakpɔwo le dɔwɔnua dzi, eʋuʋu le bɔbɔe, eye ezazã hã le bɔbɔe.
The app features colorful images, simple navigation, and easy-to-use controls.
Awɔ dɔ le iPad®, iPhone®, iPod touch®, mɔ̃ siwo dzi Android™ 3.0 le kple esiwo ava ɖe eyome hã dzi.
The app is available for iPad®, iPhone®, and iPod touch®, as well as devices running Android™ 3.0 and later.
Awɔ dɔ le Windows 8 dzi le etsɔme.
In the future, a Windows 8 version will be released.
Wobia Tso Armenia Dziɖuɖua Si Be Wòaxe Fe Na Yehowa Ðasefo 17
Armenia Ordered to Pay Damages to 17 Jehovah’s Witnesses

STRASBOURG le France​ Le November 27, 2012 dzi la, Europa Amegbetɔ Ƒe Gomenɔamesiwo Ŋuti Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea tso nya me be ele be Armenia dziɖuɖua naxe home si nye euro 112,000 (dɔlar 145,226) ɖe nu siwo dome wògble kple senyawo ƒe fe na ame 17 siwo gbe be yewomawɔ asrafodɔ o le woƒe dzitsinya ta.

STRASBOURG, France On November 27, 2012, the European Court of Human Rights ruled that the government of Armenia must pay 112,000 euros ($145,226) in damages and legal fees to 17 conscientious objectors for human rights violations.
Le ƒe 2005 me la, ɖekakpui 17 siwo nye Yehowa Ðasefowo nɔ dziɖuɖudɔ bubu aɖe wɔm ɖe asrafodɔ teƒe.
In 2005, 17 young men who are Jehovah’s Witnesses were performing alternative civilian service.
Gake esi wova de dzesii be dɔ sia le asrafowo ƒe dzikpɔkpɔ te, eye wòna yewoƒe dzitsinya le fu ɖem na yewo la, wodzudzɔ dɔa wɔwɔ.
However, when they realized that it was under the control and supervision of the military, they could no longer continue to serve in good conscience and subsequently left their places of service.
Esia na wolé wo hekplɔ wo yi ʋɔnui.
They were thereafter arrested and prosecuted.
Wozi wo dometɔ aɖewo dzi ɖe ga me ɣleti geɖe va se ɖe esime wowu nyaa dɔdrɔ̃ nu, eye mlɔeba la, wode wo dometɔ 11 mɔ́.
Some were held in pretrial detention for several months, and 11 were eventually sentenced to prison terms from two to three years.

Ame siawo dometɔ aɖewo anɔ mɔ́ me ƒe eve eye ɖewo anɔe ƒe etɔ̃. Europa Ƒe Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea tso nya me be ale si wolé ame siawo hekplɔ wo yi ʋɔnu be wonye nu vlo wɔlawo hede wo mɔ́ la mele se nu o, elabena ɣemaɣi le ƒe 2005 me la, se aɖeke menɔ Armenia dziɖuɖua si si gblɔ be enye nu vlo wɔwɔ be ame nagbe be yemawɔ dziɖuɖudɔ bubu aɖe ɖe asrafodɔ teƒe o.
The European Court ruled that these criminal prosecutions and detentions were illegal because in 2005, there was no law in Armenia that made it a crime to abandon alternative civilian service.
Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea tso nya me be Armenia dziɖuɖua tu afɔkpo Yehowa Ðasefoawo ƒe ablɔɖe kple dedienɔnɔ si le ɖekawɔwɔ me kple Europa Amegbetɔ Ƒe Gomenɔamesiwo Ŋuti Ðoɖo ƒe Se 5 lia.
The Court held that Armenia violated the Witnesses’ right to liberty and security as protected under Article 5 of the European Convention on Human Rights.
Togbɔ be Armenia dziɖuɖua te fli ɖe nu vlo wɔwɔ ƒe nya si wòtsɔ ɖe ame 17 ŋu me hã la, egbe be yemaxe fe aɖeke na wo ɖe fɔbubu wo be wonye nu vlo wɔlawo kple wo dede mɔ́ madzemadzee la ta o.
Although the government later dropped the criminal charges against the 17, Armenia refused to compensate them for the unlawful criminal prosecutions and detentions.
Le ema yome me la, Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea bia tso Armenia dziɖuɖua si be wòaxe fe na wo ɖe wo ŋu gbegblẽ kple ga si wogblẽ le senyawo me la na wo.
Therefore, the Court ordered Armenia to pay compensation for moral damages and legal fees.
Wodrɔ̃ ʋɔnu sia le ʋɔnu etɔ̃ bubu siwo ku ɖe akpaɖekedzimademade ƒe nyawo ŋu si me Europa Ƒe Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea tso nya me wòyi ɖe Armenia dziɖuɖua dzi la megbe.
This judgment comes in the wake of three other European Court rulings against Armenia on the issue of neutrality.
Le nyaa dɔdrɔ̃ eneawo katã me la, Armenia dziɖuɖumegãwo sẽ ŋuta le Yehowa Ðasefo siwo gbe be yewomawɔ asrafodɔ le dzitsinya ta o la ŋu hetu nu kpli wo abe nu vlo wɔla vɔ̃ɖiwoe wonye ene.
In all four cases, the Armenian authorities mistreated conscientious objectors who are Jehovah’s Witnesses and unjustly dealt with them as if they were dangerous criminals.
André Carbonneau, si nye ame siwo nu wotso la ƒe senyala gblɔ be: "Ale si Europa Ƒe Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea drɔ̃ nyae ɖee fia be wowɔ nu madzɔmadzɔ ɖe Yehowa Ðasefowo ŋu.
"The judgment rendered by the European Court helps to rectify the injustices suffered by these Jehovah’s Witnesses, " states André Carbonneau, an attorney for the applicants.

Dukɔ siwo katã le Europa Aɖaŋudehaa me kple dukɔwo abe Eritrea, South Korea kpakple Titina Asia dukɔwo asrɔ̃ nu tso ale si nyametsotsoawo va yi ɖe Armenia dziɖuɖua dzi le Europa Ƒe Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea ku ɖe gome si le Yehowa Ðasefowo si be woagbe asrafodɔ la me. "

"This line of victories against Armenia in the European Court sends an unmistakable message to other countries within the Council of Europe as well as countries such as Eritrea, South Korea, and countries in Central Asia regarding the right of Jehovah’s Witnesses to refuse military service. "
Dzobibi Yi Edzi Le Nu Gblẽm Vevie Le Australia
Bushfires Rage On in Australia
Tso September 2019 me la, dzobibi sẽŋuwo gblẽ nu le Australia ƒe nuto gã ɖe sia ɖe me.
Bushfires continue to intensify following the hottest and driest year on record in Australia.
Ƒea ƒe ɣeyiɣi si me dzo gblẽa nu le la ƒe gɔmedzedze koe nye esia, gake dzobibia le nu gblẽm ale gbegbe.
Since September 2019, numerous catastrophic fires have plagued every Australian state in what is just the beginning of a historic fire season.
Ƒutanutowo kple anyieheɣedzeƒe nuto siwo nye Victoria kple New South Wales ye dzobibia gblẽ nu le wu.
The coastal and southeastern regions, Victoria and New South Wales, are the worst hit.
Nyatakakawo ɖee fia be mía nɔvi aɖeke meku alo xɔ abi o, gake woƒe nunɔamesi geɖewo dome gblẽ, eye mía nɔviwo ƒe aƒe asieke dome gblẽ keŋkeŋ.
There have been no reports of deaths or injuries among our brothers, but there has been a significant loss of property, including nine homes that were completely destroyed.
Va ɖo fifia la, mía nɔvi 700 kple edzivɔwo ʋu le woƒe aƒewo me.
To date, more than 700 brothers have been evacuated.
Nyatakakawo ɖee fia be dzudzɔ kɔtɔɔ megblẽ yaa me nenema gbegbe le dukɔa me kpɔ o, eye be dzudzɔa agblẽ nu le ame sia ame si gbɔe la ƒe lãmesẽ ŋu vevie.
Many Witness families have decided to leave the affected areas because of record-setting smoke levels, which have been described by some as a public health emergency.
Nɔvi geɖe siwo ʋu la yi woƒe ƒometɔwo, wo xɔlɔ̃wo, alo gbeƒãɖela bubu siwo le teƒe siwo dzoa megblẽ nu le o la gbɔ, le hame siwo medidi boo tso wo gbɔ o la me.
Most of those evacuated have chosen to stay with family, friends, or publishers from surrounding congregations, which are not in the direct path of the fires.
Australasia alɔdzedɔwɔƒea ɖo Afɔku Kpekpeɖeŋunakɔmiti eve be woana ŋutilãmekpekpeɖeŋu nɔviawo eye woatsɔ Biblia ade dzi ƒo na wo.
The Australasia branch has formed two Disaster Relief Committees to provide spiritual and material help.
Nutome sue dzikpɔla eve kple Alɔdzekɔmitia me tɔwo le mía nɔvi siwo le nuto siwo me afɔkua gblẽ nu le la srãm kpɔ eye wole dzi dem ƒo na wo.
Two circuit overseers and members of the Branch Committee are shepherding and encouraging our brothers in the affected regions.

Togbɔ be ɖeɖi te mía nɔvi siwo ŋu dzoa gblẽ nu le la dometɔ akpa gãtɔ ŋu eye nu si dzɔ la te ɖe wo dzi hã la, wo dometɔ geɖe da akpe ɖe Kristotɔwo ƒe lɔlɔ̃ akuaku si mía nɔviwo yi edzi le ɖeɖem fia wo la ta.

Even though most of the brothers and sisters affected by the fires are exhausted, both physically and emotionally, many have expressed sincere gratitude for the genuine Christian love that our brothers continue to display.
1 Petro 2:17.
1 Peter 2:17.
Wowɔ Gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ Tɔxɛ Aɖe Le Brazil Ƒe Kɔƒenutowo Me
Special Campaign Reaches Rural Areas in Brazil
Yehowa Ðasefo akpe geɖe le gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ aɖe wɔm be yewoatsɔ Biblia me gbedeasia ayi na ame siwo le Brazil ƒe kɔƒe totroewo me.
Tens of thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses are making a special effort to share the Bible’s message with people living in rural areas of Brazil.
Wodze gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ sia gɔme tso September 1, 2018 dzi, eye ayi edzi va se ɖe December 31, 2019.
This special preaching campaign began on September 1, 2018, and will continue until December 31, 2019.
Va se ɖe fifia, gbeƒãɖela 80,000 kple edzivɔ ye kpɔ gome le gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ sia me, eye wodze Biblia sɔsrɔ̃ gɔme kple ame 16,000 kple edzivɔ.
To date, more than 80,000 publishers have participated, and more than 16,000 Bible studies have been started.
Brazil ye nye dukɔ siwo lolo wu le xexea me la ƒe atɔ̃lia.
Brazil is the world’s fifth largest country.
Wobu akɔnta be ame siwo ade miliɔn 28 ye le dukɔ ma ƒe kɔƒenutowo me.
It is estimated that some 28 million people live in the rural areas.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, ame miliɔn 22 bubuwo le kɔƒe saɖeagawo me.
An additional 22 million people live in isolated towns and villages.
Gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ sia ɖo nuto 1,600 kple edzivɔ me xoxo.
The special campaign has already reached over 1,600 territories.
Ehiã be gbeƒãɖela aɖewo nazɔ mɔ kilometa 2,000 kple edzivɔ hafi aɖo ameawo gbɔ.
Some publishers have had to travel more than 2,000 kilometers (1,243 mi) to reach people.
Gbeƒãɖela aɖe do go ŋutsu tsitsi aɖe le aƒe me esime ŋutsua nɔ dɔ wɔm tso kɔfi si wòxa la ŋu.
One publisher arrived at a house where an elderly man was processing coffee that he had harvested.
Ŋutsua kpe gbeƒãɖelaa va aƒea me eye wòyɔ srɔ̃a hegblɔ be: "Eva be yeagblɔ mawunya na mí.
The man invited the publisher inside his house and called to his wife, saying: "He came to talk about the Bible with us.
Va míasee! "
Let’s listen! "
Ŋutsua kple srɔ̃a te nya geɖewo biabiae.
The man and his wife began asking questions.
Wobia nyawo tso nu si dzɔna ɖe ame dzi ne eku, nu si tae Mawu ɖe mɔ fukpekpe li, nenye be esɔ be woana nu ewolia, ale si woakpɔ ƒomekuxiwo gbɔ, kple nya bubu geɖewo ŋu.
They inquired about the condition of the dead, why God allows suffering, whether it is right to pay tithes, how to solve family problems, and many other topics.
Ale si gbeƒãɖelaa zã Biblia tsɔ ɖo nyabiaseawo ŋui la wɔ dɔ ɖe ŋutsua dzi ale gbegbe, eye wògblɔ be yedo gbe ɖa ŋdi ma hebia Mawu nenye be yeava kpɔ ŋuɖoɖo na yeƒe nyabiase gbogbo mawo gbe ɖeka hã.
Impressed by the publisher’s Bible-based answers, the man explained that he had been praying that morning, asking God if his many questions would ever be answered.
Le gbe ma gbe ke ƒe fiẽ la, ƒome ma de Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe kpekpe zi gbãtɔ, eye woyi edzi le Biblia srɔ̃m.
The family attended their first meeting that same evening, and they are continuing to study the Bible.
Le nuto bubu aɖe me la, gbeƒãɖelawo nɔ gbeƒã ɖem tso aƒe me yi aƒe me, eye kasia tsi gã aɖe te dzadza, si wɔe be wobe tsi le kɔ aɖe dzi.
In another area, publishers were working from house to house when heavy rain forced them to take shelter in a public health clinic.
Esime wole afi ma la, wowɔ mɔnukpɔkpɔa ŋu dɔ bia nyɔnu aɖe kple via be nya kae woadi be yewoabia Mawu hã.
While there, they asked a woman and her daughter what questions they would like to ask God.
Vianyɔnuvia gblɔ be adzɔ dzi na ye ŋutɔ ne yegakpɔ ye mama si ku la ake.
The daughter said that she would love to see her late grandmother again.
Gbeƒãɖelaawo xlẽ mawunyakpukpui aɖe si ku ɖe tsitretsitsia ŋu la na wo, eye woɖe video si ƒe tanyae nye Tsitretsitsimɔkpɔkpɔa Ava Eme Kpuie la na wo.
The publishers shared with them scriptures regarding the resurrection and showed the video entitled The Resurrection Soon a Reality.
Emegbe esi gbeƒãɖelaawo yi nyɔnua gbɔ le eƒe aƒe me la, wote Biblia sɔsrɔ̃ kple eya kpakple eƒe ƒome bliboa.
Later, when the publishers visited the woman’s home, they were able to start a Bible study with her and her family.
Nyɔnua kple vianyɔnuviawo de Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe kpekpe aɖe le du aɖe si te ɖe wo ŋu la me, eye woyi Biblia sɔsrɔ̃a dzi le telefon dzi.
The woman and her daughters attended a meeting in a nearby city and are continuing their study over the telephone.
Biblia gblɔe ɖi be Mawu Fiaɖuƒea teviwo asɔ gbɔ ade "anyigba ƒe mlɔenuwo ke. "
The Bible foretells that the Kingdom of God will have subjects "to the ends of the earth. "
Gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ si wowɔ le Brazil la ɖo kpe edzi be Yehowa di be nyagblɔɖi ma nava eme.
The special campaign in rural Brazil reflects Jehovah’s will to see that prophecy fulfilled.
Psalmo 72:8.
Psalm 72:8.
siɖɔɖɔ Gblẽ Nu Le Togo
Major Flooding in Togo
Le ƒe 2019 ƒe tsidzaŋɔli le Togo la, tsi sesẽwo dza enuenu eye esia na tsi ɖe Togo ƒe dugã si nye Lomé la ƒe nuto aɖewo.
Heavy and prolonged rainfall in Togo during the 2019 rainy season has led to significant flooding on the outskirts of Lomé, Togo.
Tsia gblẽ nu le mía nɔvi 257 siwo tso hame vovovo adre me la ŋu.
Two hundred and fifty-seven publishers from seven different congregations have been affected.
Habɔbɔa wɔ ɖoɖo wole kpekpeɖeŋu nam wo.
Relief efforts are underway.
Le nuto aɖewo me la, tsia ɖɔ ale gbegbe be eɖo amewo ƒe ali gbɔ ke le woƒe aƒewo me, si wɔe be mía nɔvi 51 ʋu le woƒe aƒewo me.
In some of the affected areas, water levels in buildings reached up to one meter (3 ft 3 in), forcing 51 of our brothers and sisters to evacuate their homes.
Nɔvi siwo le nuto siwo me tsia megblẽ nu le o la xɔ nɔvi siawo ɖe woƒe aƒewo me hele wo dzi kpɔm.
Publishers nearby have opened their homes to care for the needs of those displaced.
Tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ woƒe vudometsiwo kple tsi bubu siwo wozãna.
Floodwaters contaminated some of the water sources in the area.
Benin Alɔdzekɔmitia, si kpɔa dɔa dzi le Togo la, wɔ ɖoɖo nutome sue dzikpɔlawo kple nutoa me hamemetsitsiwo le nuhiahiã veviwo mam na nɔvi siwo ŋu tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le.
The Benin Branch Committee, which oversees the work in Togo, has arranged to distribute necessary relief supplies through the circuit overseer and local elders.
Nuhiahiã vevi mawo dometɔ aɖewoe nye atike siwo ɖea ɖi le tsi me, adzalẽ kple bleach (l’eau de Javel).
These supplies include water purification tablets, disinfectant, and bleach.
Míele gbe dom ɖa be Yehowa nayra mía nɔvi siwo le Togo esime wole lɔlɔ̃ akuakua ɖem fia wo nɔewo.
We pray for Jehovah’s blessing on our brothers in Togo as they demonstrate self-sacrificing love for one another.
Yohanes 13:34, 35.
Woɖe Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia Ðe Go Le Nzemagbe Me
New World Translation Released in Nzema Language

Esi wozã ƒe ene tsɔ ɖe Ŋɔŋlɔ Kɔkɔeawo Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia bliboa gɔme ɖe Nzemagbe me vɔ megbe la, woɖee ɖe go le November 22, 2019 dzi le takpekpe gã aɖe me le Bawia, si le Ghana ƒe Ɣetoɖoƒe Nuto me.

After four years of translation work, the complete New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures was released in the Nzema language on November 22, 2019, at a regional convention in Bawia, Western Region, Ghana.
Nɔviŋutsu Samuel M. Kwesie si nye Ghana Alɔdzekɔmitia me tɔ ye ɖe Biblia ɖe go le vavala 3,051 ŋkume.
Brother Samuel M. Kwesie, a member of the Ghana Branch Committee, released the Bible before an audience of 3,051.
Gbegɔmeɖela adre ye wɔ dɔ tso Biblia sia ŋu.
A team of seven translators worked on the project.
Wo dometɔ ɖeka gblɔ be: "Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia sia me nyawo le bɔbɔe, esia awɔe be ame sia ame si axlẽe la ase egɔme, ɖeviwo gɔ̃ hã.
One of the translators stated: "The New World Translation uses simple language, making it understandable to all readers, including young people.
Ðikeke mele eme o be Biblia sia xlẽlawo agate ɖe Yehowa, wo Fofo si le dziƒo la ŋu geɖe wu. "
This will surely draw readers closer to their heavenly Father, Jehovah. "
Tsã la, gbeƒãɖela siwo doa Nzemagbe la zãa Biblia si Ghana Biblia Habɔbɔa ta.
Previously, Nzema-speaking publishers had been using a Bible published by the Bible Society of Ghana.
Ke hã, woɖe Mawu ƒe ŋkɔ ɖa le Biblia gɔmeɖeɖe ma me, eye egɔme sese sesẽ.
However, this translation omits God’s name and is difficult to understand.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, esi Bibliawo xɔ asi le Ghana ta la, esesẽ be gbeƒãɖela aɖewo nate ŋu aƒlee.
Additionally, because Bibles are expensive in Ghana, it made it difficult for some publishers to afford one.
Gake le Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe Biblia si le Nzemagbe me ya gome la, Mawu ƒe ŋkɔ Yehowa le eme, egɔme sese le bɔbɔe eye womedzranɛ o.
In contrast, the Nzema-language New World Translation contains God’s name, Jehovah, is written in clear language, and provided without cost.
Biblia sia akpe ɖe gbeƒãɖela 1,532 siwo doa Nzemagbe le Ghana ƒe alɔdzea ƒe anyigbamama me la ŋu esi woyi edzi le gbeƒã ɖem na Nzemagbedola siwo ade 330,000 la.
This Bible will benefit the 1,532 Nzema-speaking publishers in the Ghana branch territory as they preach to the some 330,000 people who speak the language.
Neva eme be mía nɔviwo nakpɔ dzidzɔ ɖe "Yehowa ƒe se la ŋu " esime wole Biblia sia zãm.
May our brothers find delight "in the law of Jehovah " with this new Bible translation.
Psalmo 1:1, 2.
Psalm 1:1, 2.
Sukuvi Aɖe Ðe Tu Ðe Eƒe Sukuxɔmehatiwo Dzi Le California, Le United States
School Shooting in California, United States
Le November 14, 2019 dzi la, sukuvi aɖe ɖe tu ɖe eƒe sukuxɔmehatiwo dzi le Santa Clarita, le California.
POn November 14, 2019, a student opened fire on fellow classmates at a high school in Santa Clarita, California.
Ewu eƒe sukuhati eve hede abi sukuvi etɔ̃ bubu ŋu, eyome wòwu eɖokui.
The gunman killed two students and wounded three, before shooting himself.
Nublanuitɔe la, mía nɔvinyɔnu aɖe ƒe vi, si ŋkɔe nye Dominic Blackwell, hã nɔ ame siwo ku la dome.
Sadly, Dominic Blackwell, the son of one of our sisters, was one of the students killed.
Ƒe 14 ye wòxɔ eye eya kple nɔa si ŋkɔe nye Nancy Blackwell wodea Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe kpekpewo edziedzi.
He was 14 years old and regularly attended meetings with his mother, Sister Nancy Blackwell.
Dominic ku gblẽ edzilawo kple eyometɔ etɔ̃awo ɖi.
Dominic is survived by his parents and three younger siblings.
Hamemetsitsi siwo le Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe haa me la zã Ŋɔŋlɔawo tsɔ le akɔ fam na eƒe ƒomea kple hamea me tɔwo hele dzi dem ƒo na wo.
The elders are providing Scriptural comfort and support to the family and the local congregation.
Ete ɖe mía dzi vevie be nu wɔnublanui sia dzɔ.
We are deeply saddened to hear about this tragedy.
Míele mɔ kpɔm vevie na ɣeyiɣi si me Mawu "atutu aɖatsi sia aɖatsi ɖa . . . , eye ku maganɔ anyi akpɔ o, konyifafa kple ɣlidodo kpakple vevesese hã maganɔ anyi o. "
We long for the time when God will "wipe out every tear . . . , and death will be no more, neither will mourning nor outcry nor pain be anymore. "
Nyaɖeɖefia 21:4.
Revelation 21:4.
Tsidzadza Sesẽ Gblẽ Nu Le Rwanda
Heavy Rainstorms Strike Rwanda
Tsi sesẽwo dza le Rwanda ƒe dziehe le October 26 kple 29, 2019 dzi, eye esia gblẽ nu le Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe ƒome geɖewo ŋu.
Widespread heavy rainstorms struck northern Rwanda on October 26 and 29, 2019, affecting several families of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Nublanuitɔe la, tsi kplɔ atsu kple asi Ðasefo aɖe ƒe vinyɔnuvi si xɔ ƒe 13 la dzoe eye wòku; esia dzɔ le Musanze Nuto si le Northern Province la me.
Tragically, the 13-year-old daughter of a Witness couple in the Musanze District of the Northern Province was swept away in the floodwaters and died.
Le Ngororero Nuto si le Western Province me la, Ðasefowo ƒe ƒome aɖe ƒe aƒe gbã eye tsi ɖe ƒome asieke ƒe agblewo eye woƒe nukuwo dome gblẽ.
In the Ngororero District of the Western Province, one Witness family suffered the destruction of their home and nine families lost their crops.
Rwanda alɔdzedɔwɔƒea wɔ ɖoɖo wole kpekpeɖeŋu nam nɔvi siwo le nuto siwo me tsidzadzaa gblẽ nu le; wole ŋutilãmekpekpeɖeŋu nam wo eye wotsɔ Biblia le dzi dem ƒo na wo.
The Rwanda branch office is coordinating relief efforts in the region, including material aid and spiritual assistance.
Míele gbe dom ɖa be Yehowa nafa akɔ na mía nɔvi siwo dzi afɔku sia dzɔ ɖo la.
We pray that Jehovah will comfort the hearts of our brothers who are suffering from this tragedy.
2 Tesalonikatɔwo 2:16, 17.
2 Thessalonians 2:16, 17.
Gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ Tɔxɛ Si Wowɔ Le Austria Kple Germany Be Woaɖo Arab-gbedolawo Gbɔ
Special Campaign for Arabic-Speaking People in Austria and Germany
Tso August 31 va se ɖe October 26, 2019 dzi la, nɔviwo tso dukɔ 19 me va kpɔ gome le Biblia-fiafiadɔ tɔxɛ aɖe si wowɔ be woaɖo Arab-gbedolawo gbɔ le Austria kple Germany la me.
From August 31 to October 26, 2019, brothers and sisters from 19 countries participated in an Arabic Bible education initiative in Austria and Germany.
Le gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ sia me la, nɔvi 1,782 zã gaƒoƒo 40,724 tsɔ fia nu amewo, woɖe míaƒe videowo zi 4,483 sɔŋ, eye woma míaƒe Biblia-srɔ̃gbalẽ 24,769.
During the course of the special campaign, the 1,782 participants spent a total of 40,724 hours in the education work, showed our videos 4,483 times, and placed 24,769 pieces of Bible literature.
Ƒe ʋɛ aɖewoe nye esiawo la, sitsoƒedila siwo wu miliɔn ɖeka ʋu va tsi Austria kple Germany, eye wo dometɔ akpa gãtɔ tso dukɔ siwo me wodoa Arabgbe le la me.
Over the past few years, more than one million refugees have entered Austria and Germany, the majority from Arabic-speaking countries.
Sitsoƒedila siawo dometɔ geɖe mese Biblia me gbedeasi si faa akɔ na ame la kpɔ o.
Many of these refugees have never heard the Bible’s comforting message.
Nɔvi siwo tso Canada, United States kple Europa dukɔ vovovowo me la va kpe asi ɖe gbeƒãɖela 1,108 siwo le Austria kple Germany eye woɖea gbeƒã na Arab-gbedolawo la ŋu.
Visiting brothers and sisters from Canada, the United States, and various countries in Europe supported the 1,108 publishers in Austria and Germany who serve in the Arabic field.
Wowɔ dɔ le nuto 24 me, eye dugãwo abe Berlin, Cologne, Dresden, Frankfurt, Graz, Hamburg kple Vienna ene hã le me.
Together they visited 24 regions, including major cities like Berlin, Cologne, Dresden, Frankfurt, Graz, Hamburg, and Vienna.
Nɔviŋutsu aɖe si le dukɔ siwo me wowɔ gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛa le dometɔ ɖeka me gblɔ be: "Meva susu me na mí kpɔ be gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ sia ade dzi ƒo na mí nenema gbegbe o.
One local brother wrote: "The campaign had such a positive impact on us, one we would never have imagined.
Nɔvi siwo tso duta va la do ŋusẽ mí ŋutɔ, eye míekpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe kpekpeɖeŋu si wova na mí la ŋu ale gbegbe.
The visiting brothers have invigorated us, and we are so grateful for their help.
Edzɔ dzi na mí ŋutɔ be mɔnukpɔkpɔ sia su mía si míekpɔ gome le gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛ sia me. "
We very much appreciated the privilege to participate in this special campaign. "
Esi ɖekakpui aɖe si tso dukɔ aɖe si me wodoa Arabgbe le la de Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe kpekpe aɖe vɔ megbe la, ete ɖe nɔviŋutsu aɖe ŋu hebia dzidzɔtɔe be: "Ènya nu si mahabba fia le Germanygbe mea? "
After attending a meeting of Jehovah’s Witnesses, a young man from an Arabic-speaking country approached a brother and asked with excitement: "Do you know what mahabba means in German? "
Nɔviŋutsua ɖo eŋu be, "Liebe (si gɔmee nye ‘lɔlɔ̃’)! "
The brother responded, "Liebe (love)! "
Ðekakpuia gblɔ be, "Tututu, esia teƒee mekpɔ le afi sia egbea!
"Yes, " said the young man, "that’s what I saw here in action today!
Miewɔ nu ɖe ŋunye nyuie ŋutɔ.
You were so kind to me.
Ame sia ame do gbe nam hena asim.
Everyone greeted me and shook my hand.
Mekpɔ amewo tso dukɔ vovovowo me siwo wɔ nu ɖe wɔ nɔewo ŋu bubutɔe.
I saw people from different countries who treated each other with respect.
Ne ame sia ame awɔ nu alea la, meka ɖe edzi be nuwo anyo le xexea me kura wu ale si wole fifia! "
If everyone would act this way, the whole world would be different, that’s for sure! "
Ŋutsu bubu aɖe gblɔ tso Yehowa Ðasefowo ŋu be: "Mienya ale si miawɔ nu ɖe amewo ŋu nyuie eye mienye amewo ƒe ƒuƒoƒo nyuitɔ kekeake siwo le anyigba dzi la dometɔ ɖeka. "
Another man stated about Jehovah’s Witnesses: "You have become skilled in your interactions with people, and you have built one of the best communities in the world. "
Atsu kple asi Arab-gbedola siwo le Germany abe ƒe ɖekae nye esia ene la kpe nɔvi aɖewo va woƒe aƒe me be woano tii.
A couple from an Arabic-speaking country who have lived in Germany for about a year invited brothers to their home for tea.
Esi nɔviawo gblɔ nu si tae wova dukɔa me na atsu kple asia la, nyɔnua bia wo be, "Yehowa Ðasefowoe mienyea? "
After the brothers explained the purpose of their visit, the wife asked, "Are you Jehovah’s Witnesses? "
Esi nɔviawo ɖo eŋu be "ɛ̃ " la, nyɔnua gblɔ be: "Ewɔ nuku lo!
When the brothers confirmed this, the wife replied: "Unbelievable!
Mele Ðasefowo dim ɣleti geɖewoe nye esia.
I’ve been looking for you for months.
Medi mi le ketekedzeƒea gɔ̃ hã.
I even went to the main train station to look for you.
Eye miawoe nye esia va gbɔnye!
And here you are. You came to me!
Mawue dɔ mi. "
It is God who sent you. "
Yehowa yra ɖe dzonɔameme si mía nɔviwo ɖe fia esi wokpɔ gome le gbeƒãɖeɖedɔ tɔxɛa me be "dukɔwo katã me tɔwo " nase Biblia me gbedeasi si naa mɔkpɔkpɔ la dzi ale gbegbe.
Jehovah greatly blessed the zeal of the brothers and sisters who took part in this special campaign to share the Bible’s message of hope with "people of all the nations. "
Mateo 28:19.
Matthew 28:19.
Russia Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe Ka Ƒe Ade Na Nɔviŋutsu Klimov Be Wòatsɔ Anɔ Gaxɔ Me, Esiae Nye Fɔbuame Sesẽtɔ Kekeake Tso Esime Woɖo Asi Ðasefowo Dzi Le Ƒe 2017 Me
Russian Court Orders Brother Klimov to Six Years in Prison, Harshest Sentence Issued Since 2017 Ban
Le November 5, 2019 dzi la, Oktyabrsky Nutome Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe si le Tomsk la ka ƒe ade na Nɔviŋutsu Sergey Klimov be wòatsɔ anɔ gaxɔ me.
On November 5, 2019, the Oktyabrsky District Court of Tomsk sentenced Brother Sergey Klimov to six years in prison.
Dennis Christensen koe ganye nɔviŋutsu si woka ƒe mawo gbegbe na be wòatsɔ anɔ gaxɔ me le Russia.
Dennis Christensen is the only other brother in Russia to have received a sentence of this length.

Gake le Nɔviŋutsu Klimov ya gome la, ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea gada mɔxenu bubu geɖewo ɖe edzi, si wɔe be etɔ va nye fɔbuame sesẽtɔ kekeake si yi na mía nɔviwo dometɔ ɖeka tso esime Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe Kɔkɔtɔ ɖo asi Ðasefowo dzi le ƒe 2017 me.
However, in Brother Klimov’s case, the court imposed several additional restrictions, making his the harshest sentence imposed on one of our brothers since the 2017 Supreme Court ban.
Wolé Nɔviŋutsu Klimov le June 3, 2018 dzi esi poliswo kple gbadagbawo va dze Yehowa Ðasefowo ƒe aƒe eve dzi.
Brother Klimov was arrested on June 3, 2018, after law enforcement, including special forces, invaded two homes of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Wolé nɔviŋutsu kple nɔvinyɔnu 30 aɖewo be woabia gbe wo nɔvinyɔnu aɖe si xɔ ƒe 83 hã nɔ ame siwo wolé la dome.
Some 30 brothers and sisters, including an 83-year-old sister, were taken away for questioning.
Woɖe asi le nɔviawo katã ŋu, negbe Nɔviŋutsu Klimov ko.
All but Brother Klimov were released.
Wotso enu be ewɔ nu vlowo, eye ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe aɖe na wolée tu ɣleti eve hafi woava drɔ̃ ʋɔnui.
Criminal charges were brought against him, and a court ordered that he be placed in pretrial detention for two months.

Hafi woava drɔ̃ ʋɔnui la, wodidi ɣeyiɣi si wolée tu la ɖe edzi zi gbɔ zi adre, si fia be hafi eƒe gaxɔmenɔnɔ ŋutɔŋutɔ si axɔ ƒe ade nadze egɔme la, wokplɔe dzoe le srɔ̃a kple eƒe ƒomeawo gbɔ ƒe ɖeka kple ɣleti atɔ̃.
His term was extended seven times, meaning that even before beginning his six-year prison sentence, he has been incarcerated separated from his wife and family for a year and five months.
Senyala siwo le Nɔviŋutsu Klimov ta ʋlim la abia be woagbugbɔ nyaa adrɔ̃.
Lawyers for Brother Klimov will appeal his conviction.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, le August 20, 2018 dzi la, wotsɔ Klimov v. Russia ƒe nyaa yi na Europa Amegbetɔ Ƒe Gomenɔamesiwo Ŋuti Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea ɖe ale si wolée tu la ta.
Additionally, on August 20, 2018, the complaint Klimov v. Russia was filed with the European Court of Human Rights regarding his pretrial detention.
Le ƒe 2019 bliboa me la, Ðasefowo dzi dzedze kple wo léle tu dzi ɖe edzi ŋutɔ le Russia.
Throughout 2019, we have seen an increase in raids, arrests, and detentions in Russia.
Ke hã, mía nɔviawo lé dzi ɖe ƒo heyi edzi le nuteƒe wɔm.
Yet, our brothers remain undeterred.
Nu siwo ɖo kpe edzi be Yehowa le mía nɔviwo yram ɖe ale si woɖoa dzi ɖe eŋu bliboe ta la dea dzi ƒo na mí ŋutɔ.
We are encouraged by the evidence that Jehovah is blessing our brothers’ full confidence in him.
Psalmo 56:1-5, 9.
Tsiɖɔɖɔ Gã Aɖe Gblẽ Nu Le Spain Ƒe Ɣedzeƒe
Severe Flooding Causes Devastation in Eastern Spain
Le September kple October 2019 me la, tsi gãwo dza enuenu le Spain ƒe ɣedzeƒe eye esia gblẽ nu geɖe ŋutɔ.
Several rounds of heavy rain caused widespread destruction in eastern Spain during the months of September and October 2019.
Tsi siawo ƒe gãtɔ dza le October 23 dzi le Tarragona nuto me eye esia na Francolí Tɔsisi la ɖɔ gbagba eteƒe mekɔ o.
The most serious of these occurred on October 23 in the province of Tarragona when the Francolí River turned into a raging flood.
Nublanuitɔe la, ame atɔ̃ bu woƒe agbe le tsiɖɔɖɔ sia me.
Sadly, five people lost their lives in this flood.
Wo dometɔ eve nye mía nɔviwo. Mía nɔvi siawo kpã tso hame ƒe kpekpe heɖo ta aƒe me, eye esime wonɔ tɔdzisasrã aɖe dzi tom la, kasia tsiɖɔɖɔa kplɔ woƒe ʋua ɖe enu dzoe.
Among these were two of our brothers who were crossing a bridge on the way home from a congregation meeting when their car was suddenly swept away.
Hamemetsitsiwo le akɔ fam na hamea me tɔwo elabe woƒe dzi gbã le nɔvi siawo ƒe ku ta.
The elders are comforting the local congregation as they mourn this tragedy.
Spain Alɔdzekɔmitia me tɔ aɖe hã yi vɛ srã hamea kpɔ hefa akɔ na wo eye wòde dzi ƒo na wo.
A member of the Spain Branch Committee has visited the congregation to provide additional shepherding.
Míele gbe dom ɖa be Yehowa nayi edzi afa akɔ na mía nɔviŋutsuwo kple nɔvinyɔnuwo le xaxa sia me.
We pray that Jehovah continues to comfort our brothers and sisters during this trial.
2 Korintotɔwo 1:3, 4.
2 Corinthians 1:3, 4.
Ƒe 2019 Ƒe Sia Ƒe Takpekpea Ƒe Totoɖeme
2019 Annual Meeting Summary

Le Memleɖa, October 5, 2019 dzi la, Gbetakpɔxɔ Biblia Kple Trakt Habɔbɔ Si Le Pennsylvania la wɔ eƒe dɔwɔnyawo ƒe kpekpea le Yehowa Ðasefowo Ƒe Takpexɔ si le Newburgh, le New York, U.S.A. Esi wowu dɔwɔnyawo ƒe kpekpea nu la, Dɔdzikpɔhaa xɔ ŋgɔ na kpekpe aɖe si me wotsɔ gbɔgbɔmenunyiamewo tu ame 20,679 sɔŋ ɖo. Nyaselaawo dometɔ aɖewo nɔ takpekpewɔƒea, eye bubuwo hã tsiã ka kpli wo.

On Saturday, October 5, 2019, the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society of Pennsylvania held its annual business meeting at the Assembly Hall of Jehovah’s Witnesses in Newburgh, New York, U.S.A. After the business meeting, the Governing Body presented an upbuilding spiritual program to an audience of 20,679, including those at tied-in venues.
Nya siwo gbɔna la nye nu siwo yi edzi le kpekpea me la ƒe totoɖeme.
The following is a summary of each part.
"Ame Ðekae Nye Miaƒe Kplɔla, Eyae Nye Kristo La "
"Your Leader Is One, the Christ "
Nɔviŋutsu Gerrit Lösch, si nye ame si nɔ zi me na ɖoɖowɔɖia la ƒo nuƒo gbãtɔ si wotu ɖe Mateo 23:10 dzi, tsɔ ɖo ŋku edzi na mí be Yesu Kristo ye nye míaƒe kplɔla, ke menye amegbetɔ aɖekee o.
Brother Gerrit Lösch, who served as the chairman for the program, delivered the opening talk based on Matthew 23:10, reminding us that Jesus Christ is our leader, not any man.
Yehowa Toa Míaƒe Kpekpeɖeŋunana Ƒe Subɔsubɔdɔa Dzi Naa Kpekpeɖeŋu
Our Relief Ministry, Used by Jehovah to Provide Relief
Nɔviŋutsu Stephen Lett ɖe susu si tae wòle vevie be míanye ame siwo naa nu kple dzidzɔ la me.
Brother Stephen Lett explained the importance of being cheerful givers.
Mɔ aɖe si nu míaɖee afia le be míenye nunalawo ye nye be míanɔ asi kpem ɖe míaƒe kpekpeɖeŋunana ƒe subɔsubɔdɔa ŋu.
One area in which we can show ourselves to be generous is by supporting our relief ministry.
Nɔviŋutsu Lett na nyatakakawo ku ɖe nu siwo gbegbe dzɔdzɔmefɔkuwo gblẽ kpakple kpekpeɖeŋunadɔ siwo míewɔ le ƒe 2018 kple ƒe 2019 ƒe subɔsubɔƒeawo me la ŋu.
Brother Lett provided a summary of the damage caused by natural disasters and our subsequent relief work during the 2018 and 2019 service years.
Afɔku siawo gblẽ nu le nɔvi siwo wu 900,000 la ŋu; Fiaɖuƒe Akpata siwo wu 700 kple mía nɔviwo ƒe aƒe siwo wu 15,000 ŋue afɔkuawo gblẽ nu le alo gbã keŋkeŋ.
Over 900,000 brothers and sisters were affected by such disasters; more than 700 Kingdom Halls and 15,000 homes of our brothers were damaged or destroyed.
Yehowa Ðasefowo zã ga dɔlar miliɔn 49.5 kple edzivɔ ɖe kpekpeɖeŋunadɔ siawo ŋu.
Jehovah’s Witnesses spent $49.5 million on relief efforts.
Le eƒe nuƒoa me la, woɖe video siwo me nɔvi siwo kpekpeɖeŋunadɔawo ɖe vi na la ɖe woƒe dzimenyawo gblɔ tso ale si wokpɔ ŋudzedze ɖe kpekpeɖeŋu si wona wo ŋu la ŋu.
This part included videos that contained heartfelt expressions of appreciation from publishers who benefited from our relief ministry.
‘Mawu Ƒe Asi Nyui La Le Mía Dzi . . .
‘The Good Hand of Our God Is Upon Us . . .
Mina Míatso Ne Míaɖo Glia’ | Video
Let Us Get Up and Build’ | Video
Wogblɔ le video sia me be xɔ 80,000 kloe ye le Yehowa Ðasefowo si siwo wole be lém na.
This video explained that Jehovah’s Witnesses care for almost 80,000 buildings worldwide.
Woƒo nu tso ale si míewɔna léa be na xɔ siwo míezãna na teokrasiwɔnawo, ale si míegbugbɔna trɔa asi le wo ŋu kple ale si míetua woe hã ŋu le videoa me.
It also highlighted the strategies we employ to maintain, renovate, and construct theocratic facilities.
Anyigbawo Kple Xɔwo Ƒeƒle Ƒe Ŋutinya | Video
A Historic Look at Property Acquisitions | Video

Le video sia me la, wobia gbe nɔviŋutsu etɔ̃ aɖewo siwo na kpekpeɖeŋu le ƒe siwo va yi me le anyigbawo didi kple wo ƒeƒle na United States alɔdzedɔwɔƒea kple habɔbɔa ƒe dɔwɔƒegã la me: woawoe nye Nɔviŋutsu Max Larson, George Couch, kple Gilbert Nazaroff.

This recording included archived interviews of three brothers who assisted in the past with selecting and purchasing properties for the United States branch and world headquarters: Brothers Max Larson, George Couch, and Gilbert Nazaroff.
Nɔviŋutsu etɔ̃awo katã gblɔ ale si wokpɔe kɔtɛ be Yehowa ƒe asi ye nɔ eme hafi wote ŋu ƒle anyigba kple xɔ vovovoawo.
All three of these brothers related how they saw clear evidence of Jehovah’s hand in the acquisition of various properties.
Wowɔ Ðoɖo Ðe Xɔtudɔ Yeye Aɖe Ŋu | Video
A New Construction Project Is Being Planned | Video
Woɖe gbeƒãe le video sia me be Yehowa Ðasefowo wɔ ɖoɖo be yewoana videowo wɔwɔ ƒe dɔ vovovoawo nayi edzi le teƒe ɖeka, si nye dɔwɔƒe yeye aɖe si woatu ɖe Ramapo, le New York.
This video announced that Jehovah’s Witnesses plan to consolidate media production into a new facility to be constructed in Ramapo, New York.
Anyigba si dzi woatu xɔa ɖo la didi tso habɔbɔa ƒe dɔwɔƒegã si le Warwick, New York la gbɔ abe kilometa etɔ̃ ene.
The property is located approximately two miles (3 km) from world headquarters in Warwick, New York.
Taɖodzinua ye nye be woadze xɔ sia tutu gɔme le ƒe 2022 me eye woawu enu le December 2026 me.
The goal is to begin construction in 2022 and complete it by December 2026.
Ne xɔtudɔa va ɖo afi si woahiã na dɔwɔla gbogbotɔwo le la, woahiã na lɔlɔ̃nu faa dɔwɔla abe 1,500 ene gbe sia gbe.
During the peak of construction, the project will require an estimated 1,500 volunteers per day.
Betel xɔ yeye si woatu ɖe Ramapo, le New York la ƒe nɔnɔmetata.
A rendering of the new Bethel facility to be constructed in Ramapo, New York.
Nyaléleɖemɔ̃dzi dɔwɔƒe, ɔfiswo, xɔdɔmewo kple amedzrowo xɔƒe anɔ teƒea
The design includes studio space, offices, residences, and a visitor center
Mɔnu Yeye Si Dzi Woato Akpe Dɔbiagbalẽviwo Ðo | Video
A New Application for Processing Applications | Video
Video sia na eme kɔ be tso January 2020 me la, gbeƒãɖela siwo di be yewoakeke yewoƒe subɔsubɔdɔa ɖe enu la ate ŋu akpe dɔbiagbalẽvi ɖo le jw.org eye woaɖoe ɖe woƒe hamemetsitsiwo ƒe haa be wòato eme.
This video explained that beginning January 2020, publishers interested in expanding their ministry will be able to fill out applications on jw.org and submit them to their body of elders for review.
Mɔnu Yeye Aɖe Si Dzi Míato Ake Ðe Odio Nuwo Ŋu Le JW.ORG
A New Way to Access JW.ORG Audio Files
Anya wɔ azɔ be míaƒo ha alo nya aɖewo siwo le jw.org la ase le mɔ̃ siwo zãa Amazon Alexa alo Google Assistant la dzi.
Select audio content on jw.org may now be accessed via Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant.
Amedzidzedze Si Atso Dziehe
An Attack Coming From the North
Nɔviŋutsu David Splane ƒo nu tso asitɔtrɔ si wowɔ ku ɖe ale si míese nyagblɔɖi si dze le Yoel ta 2 ku ɖe ʋetsuviwo ƒe ha gã aɖe ŋu gɔme la ŋu.
Brother David Splane clarified our understanding of the prophecy recorded in Joel chapter 2 describing a swarm of locusts.
Míele mɔ kpɔm be míava srɔ̃ nu tso numekɔkɔ sia si woava ɖe ɖe go le Gbetakpɔxɔ me la ŋu.
We look forward to studying this clarified understanding when it appears in The Watchtower.
Ŋɔŋlɔ Kɔkɔeawo Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe (Nusɔsrɔ̃tɔ) tso Mateo va se ɖe Dɔwɔwɔwo
The New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures (Study Edition) from Matthew through Acts
Zã Nusɔsrɔ̃ Biblia Nàtsɔ Asrɔ̃ Bibliae
Study the Bible With the Study Bible
Nɔviŋutsu Samuel Herd ƒo nu tso viɖe siwo le Ŋɔŋlɔ Kɔkɔeawo Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe (Nusɔsrɔ̃tɔ) si ŋu míate ŋu ake ɖo le Internet dzi zazã me la ŋu.
Brother Samuel Herd highlighted the benefits of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures (Study Edition) that can be accessed online.
Eyome eɖe Ŋɔŋlɔ Kɔkɔeawo Xexe Yeye Gɔmeɖeɖe (Nusɔsrɔ̃tɔ) ƒe tata, si me Mateo ƒe agbalẽa va se ɖe Dɔwɔwɔwo le la, ɖe go.
He then released the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures (Study Edition) from the books of Matthew through Acts in print form.
Gbeƒãɖelawo ate ŋu adɔe to woƒe hamewo dzi.
Publishers may request a copy through their local congregation.
Dɔ Geɖe Li Míawɔ!
We Have Work to Do!
Nɔviŋutsu Anthony Morris te gbe ɖe edzi be gbeƒãɖeɖe nya nyuia ye nye dɔ vevitɔ na Kristotɔ vavãwo.
Brother Anthony Morris emphasized that for true Christians, preaching the good news is our paramount assignment.
Xɔ siwo wotu hena teokrasidɔwo wɔwɔ la kpena ɖe Dɔdzikpɔhaa ŋu wòwɔa ɖoɖo ɖe gbeƒãɖeɖedɔa ŋu eye wònana gbɔgbɔmenuɖuɖu kaa Yehowa ƒe amewo si.
Theocratic facilities support the Governing Body in organizing the preaching work and in providing spiritual food to Jehovah’s people.

Nɔviŋutsu Morris he susu yi nya ʋãme aɖewo siwo dze le November 15, 1976 ƒe Gbetakpɔxɔ me la dzi; egblɔ be: "Ele be kaka ‘xaxa gã’ la nava la, míabiã ŋku ɖe gbeƒãɖeɖe nya nyuia ŋu le anyigba bliboa dzi wu ɣeyiɣi bubu ɖe sia ɖe le ŋutinya me.

Brother Morris quoted the stirring words from the November 15, 1976, issue of The Watchtower: "The arrival of the ‘great tribulation’ should find the preaching work at the height of its forward movement, at the very peak of its momentum throughout the earth.
Ɣeyiɣi si me Aƒetɔ Yesu ava be yeadrɔ̃ ʋɔnu la awɔ nuku na ame sia ame awɔ nuku na Yehowa ƒe amewo gɔ̃ hã, elabena ava le ɣeyiɣi si me wovu ɖe Yehowa ƒe dɔwo wɔwɔ ŋu wu ɣeyiɣi bubu ɖe sia ɖe! "
The arrival of the Lord Jesus to execute judgment will come as a complete surprise even to Jehovah’s people, for it will no doubt find them at their busiest time of activity! "
Ðe Susu Aɖe Li Si Tae Míavɔ̃ Ðoa?
What Do We Have to Fear?
Nɔviŋutsu Mark Sanderson na eme kɔ be abe ale si Yesu gblɔe ɖi ene la, Mawu ƒe amewo kpɔa mɔ be "dukɔwo katã " alé fu yewo.
Brother Mark Sanderson explained that, as Jesus prophesied, God’s people expect to be hated by "all the nations. "
(Mateo 24:9) Gake Nɔviŋutsu Sanderson de dzi ƒo na mí be míagavɔ̃ amewo o, ke boŋ míavɔ̃ Yehowa.
(Matthew 24:9) However, Brother Sanderson encouraged us to fear, not humans, but Jehovah.
Psalmo 111:10.
Psalm 111:10.
Woɖe video wɔdɔɖeamedzi aɖe si me mía nɔvi siwo yome woti le Russia la ƒo nu tso ale si woɖu vɔvɔ̃ na yometiti dzi le la ŋu.
A touching video was presented of persecuted brothers and sisters in Russia expressing how they overcame their fear of persecution.
Nuƒoa kple videoa siaa de dzi ƒo na Yehowa ƒe amewo katã be woatu nɔnɔme ma ke ɖo.
This talk and video encouraged all of Jehovah’s people to develop that same spirit.
Ðe Nèle Ŋute Le Susu Me Bliboea?
Are You Completely Sober?
Nɔviŋutsu Geoffrey Jackson ƒo nu tso nya aɖewo siwo dze le Kristotɔwo Ƒe Hela Ŋɔŋlɔawo me siwo fia "ŋutenɔnɔ le susu me " la ŋu eye wògblɔ ale si míatsɔ nya mawo ade dɔwɔwɔ mee.
Brother Geoffrey Jackson made practical application of texts in the Christian Greek Scriptures that use a term that literally means "sober. "
Azɔ hã ete gbe ɖe ale si wòle vevie be ‘míanɔ mo xexi bliboe’ (si fia be "míanɔ ŋute bliboe le susu me ") le ŋkeke mamlɛ siawo me dzi.
He also stressed the importance of continuing to ‘keep our senses completely’ (literally "being sober perfectly ") during these last days.
1 Petro 1:13.
1 Peter 1:13.
Ðe Nàtsɔ Ðe Le Eme Na Woa?
Will You Care for It?
Nɔviŋutsu Kenneth Cook ɖe gbeƒã ƒe 2020 ƒe mawunyakpukpuia, si nye Mateo 28:19, afi si gblɔ be: "Eya ta miheyi ɖawɔ . . . nusrɔ̃lawo, mianyrɔ wo. "
Brother Kenneth Cook announced the yeartext for 2020, Matthew 28:19: "Go, therefore, and make disciples . . . , baptizing them. "
Ete gbe ɖe ale si gbegbe wòle vevie be míakpe ɖe ame siwo si dzi nyui le ŋu be woatsɔ woƒe agbe aɖe adzɔgbe na Yehowa eye woaxɔ nyɔnyrɔ la dzi.
He emphasized the need to help those who have the right heart condition to dedicate their lives to Jehovah and be baptized.
Kpekpe siwo me wodzroa ŋɔŋlɔawo me nyawo le, abe ƒe sia ƒe takpekpea ene, la doa ŋusẽ mí be míayi edzi aku kutri geɖe le Yehowa subɔsubɔ me.
Spiritual programs like the annual meeting motivate us to continue exerting ourselves in our service to Jehovah.
Ahom Sesẽ Si Woyɔ Be Tapah Gblẽ Nu Le Japan Ƒe Anyiehe
Typhoon Tapah Hits Southern Japan
Tso September 21 va de asi na 23, 2019 la, ahom sesẽ si woyɔ be Tapah la tu le Japan ƒe anyiehe si he yaƒoƒo sesẽwo kple tsidzadza gãwo vɛ.
From September 21 to 23, 2019, Typhoon Tapah struck southern Japan with powerful winds and rain.
Ahom sia wɔe be yameʋuwo kple ketekewo mete ŋu wɔ dɔ o, eye dzo menɔ aƒe 30,000 kple edzivɔ me o.
The storm caused flight cancellations, railway suspensions, and left over 30,000 homes without electricity.
Le du siwo nye Okinawa kple Kyushu me la, nu vevi wɔ ame 50 kple edzivɔ.
In Okinawa and Kyushu, more than 50 people were injured.
Japan alɔdzedɔwɔƒea ka nya ta be nu vevi wɔ gbeƒãɖela atɔ̃, eye wo dometɔ ɖeka nye nɔvinyɔnu aɖe si wosika ɖe kɔdzi.
The Japan branch office reports that five publishers were injured, including one sister who was hospitalized.
Nu gblẽ le mía nɔviwo ƒe aƒe siwo wu 50 la ŋu.
Over 50 homes of our brothers sustained damage.
Afɔku Ŋuti Kpekpeɖeŋunakɔmiti aɖe kple nɔviŋutsu siwo dze la tso kpla le ŋutilãme kple gbɔgbɔme kpekpeɖeŋu si gbeƒãɖela siwo ŋu ahom la gblẽ nu le hiã la nam wo.
A Disaster Relief Committee and responsible brothers are responding to the immediate physical and spiritual needs of the affected publishers.
Japan alɔdzedɔwɔƒea ayi edzi alé ŋku ɖe ale si nuwo le na nɔvi siwo ŋu ahom la gblẽ nu le la ŋu ahana kpekpeɖeŋu si wohiã la wo.
The Japan branch will continue to monitor the effects of this typhoon and provide needed support.
Míedo gbe ɖa be mía nɔvi siwo le Japan la ayi edzi aɖo ŋu ɖe Yehowa ŋu be wòafa akɔ na wo le ɣeyiɣi sesẽ siawo me.
We pray that our brothers in Japan continue to rely on Jehovah for comfort during this trial.
Psalmo 94:19.
Psalm 94:19.
Tajikistan Dziɖuɖua Bu Fɔ Nɔviŋutsu Shamil Khakimov Si Xɔ Ƒe 68 La Madzemadzee Heka Ƒe Adre Kple Afã Nɛ Be Wòatsɔ Anɔ Gaxɔ Me
Tajik Authorities Unjustly Sentence 68-Year-Old Brother Shamil Khakimov to Seven and a Half Years in Prison
Le September 10, 2019 dzi la, Khujand Dua ƒe Ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒe si le Tajikistan la ka ƒe adre kple afã na Nɔviŋutsu Shamil Khakimov be wòatsɔ anɔ gaxɔ me, le esi wòƒo nu tso eƒe dzixɔsewo ŋu na amewo ko ta.
On September 10, 2019, the Khujand City Court in Tajikistan sentenced Brother Shamil Khakimov to seven and a half years in prison for merely sharing his religious beliefs with others.
Yehowa Ðasefowo le agbagba dzem be yewoana woagbugbɔ nyaa adrɔ̃.
Jehovah’s Witnesses are appealing this case.
Tso ƒe 2019 ƒe gɔmedzedze lɔƒo ye Nɔviŋutsu Khakimov ƒe fukpekpewo dze egɔme.
Brother Khakimov’s ordeal began in early 2019.
Le February 26 dzi la, poliswo va lé Shamil si xɔ ƒe 68 hetso enu be ele "eƒom ɖe amewo nu be woalé fu subɔsubɔha bubu me tɔwo. "
On February 26, authorities arrested 68-year-old Shamil, charging him with "inciting religious hatred. "
Emegbe ʋɔnudrɔ̃ƒea na wolée tu evɔ womedrɔ̃ ʋɔnui o, eye wodidi ɣeyiɣi si wolée tu la ɖe edzi wòxɔ ɣleti ade.
Afterward, the court placed him in pretrial detention, which eventually was extended for six months.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe ale si wolé Nɔviŋutsu Khakimov de ga madzemadzee ŋu la, wowɔ dɔ nɛ eteƒe medidi o koe nye ema eye ʋusɔgbɔdɔ hã le eŋu.
In addition to dealing with this unjust prison term, Brother Khakimov suffers from high blood pressure and is still recovering from a medical procedure.

Do ŋgɔ na nudzɔdzɔ sia la, wolé Daniil Islamov si xɔ ƒe 18 la le ƒe 2017 me heka ɣleti ade nɛ be wòatsɔ anɔ gaxɔ me, le esi wògbe be yemado asrafowu ahage ɖe asrafohaa me o ta; tso ema dzi la, womegalé Yehowa Ðasefo aɖeke de gaxɔ me kpɔ o va se ɖe esime wolé Nɔviŋutsu Khakimov.

This is the first time one of Jehovah’s Witnesses has been imprisoned in Tajikistan since 2017, when 18-year-old Daniil Islamov was given a six-month prison sentence for refusing to wear a military uniform.
Fifia Tajikistan hã va le dukɔ atɔ̃ siwo lé Yehowa Ðasefo ɖeka ya teti de gaxɔ me la dome.
Tajikistan is now one of five countries that have imprisoned at least one of Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Dukɔ ene susɔeawoe nye Eritrea, Russia, Singapore, kple Turkmenistan.
The other four are Eritrea, Russia, Singapore, and Turkmenistan.
Míele gbe dom ɖa be Yehowa nayi edzi akpe ɖe Nɔviŋutsu Khakimov ŋu le go sia go me be wòado dzi le xaxa sia me.
We pray that Jehovah will continue to supply Brother Khakimov everything that he needs to endure this trial.
Romatɔwo 15:5.
Romans 15:5.
Kristotɔwo Ƒe Akpaɖekedzimademade Le South Korea Enye Xɔse Kple Dzinɔameƒo Ƒe Ŋutinya
Christian Neutrality in South Korea​ History of Faith and Courage
Tso keke ƒe 1953 mee wote nɔviŋutsu ɖekakpuiwo lelé de ga le Korea le esi wogbe be yewomawɔ asrafodɔ o ta.
Since 1953, young Korean brothers have been imprisoned for refusing military service.
Ne wotsɔ ƒe siwo nɔviŋutsu 19,000 kple edzivɔwo tsɔ nɔ gaxɔ me le esi woyi edzi lé woƒe xɔse me ɖe asi la katã ƒo ƒu la, ele ƒe 36,000.
Altogether, more than 19,000 brothers who refused to compromise their faith have spent a total of 36,000 years in prison.
Ke hã le February 28, 2019 dzi la, woɖe asi le mía nɔviŋutsu mamlɛtɔ si nɔ gaxɔ me la ŋu.
However, on February 28, 2019, the last of our imprisoned brothers was released.
Aleke wòdzɔe be nudzɔdzɔ ɖedzesi sia va eme?
But how did such a historical occasion come to be?
Na míakpɔ ale si Korea nɔviwo ɖe xɔse sẽŋu kple dzinɔameƒo ɖedzesi fia le ƒe siwo va yi me la ɖa.
Let’s take a look at the record of strong faith and unwavering courage among the Korean brothers.
Tsiɖɔɖɔ Gblẽ Nu Le Ɣetoɖoƒe India
Flooding Hits Western India
Woka nya ta le nyadzɔdzɔwo me be ame 169 ya teti ku esi tsiɖɔɖɔ gblẽ nu le India ƒe ɣetoɖoƒe nuto siwo nye Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, kple Kerala me.
According to a media outlet, floods in India have killed at least 169 people in the western states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Kerala.
Alɔdzedɔwɔƒe si le India la ka nya ta be mía nɔviŋutsu kple nɔvinyɔnu aɖeke meku alo xɔ abi le tsiɖɔɖɔa me o.
The India branch office reports that none of our brothers and sisters were killed or injured by the flooding.
Tsiɖɔɖɔa ŋuti nyatakaka siwo tso alɔdzedɔwɔƒea gbɔ la nye esiwo gbɔna.
The branch has provided the following details.
Gujarat: Le du si nye Vadodara me la, tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le gbeƒãɖela 145 ŋu.
Gujarat: In the city of Vadodara, a total of 145 publishers were affected by the floodwaters.
Naneke megblẽ le Gujarati gbegɔmeɖedɔwɔƒe si le Vadodara ŋu o.
The Gujarati remote translation office, which is located in Vadodara, was not damaged.
Maharashtra: Le du si nye Mumbai me la, tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le ƒome ade aɖewo ƒe aƒewo ŋu.
Maharashtra: In Mumbai, the homes of six families were affected.
Le du si nye Sangli, si didi tso Mumbai abe kilometa 378 ene le anyieheɣedzeƒe gome me la, gbeƒãɖela 25 zu aƒemanɔsitɔwo.
In the city of Sangli, located some 378 kilometers (235 mi) southeast of Mumbai, 25 publishers were displaced.
Nɔvi siwo le du aɖe si te ɖe wo ŋu me la di mlɔƒewo na wo gbɔ.
Brothers in a nearby city provided temporary accommodations.
Karnataka: Tsiɖɔɖɔa wɔe be ƒome ade aɖewo zu aƒemanɔsitɔwo.
Karnataka: Six families were displaced by the floods.
Karnataka ye alɔdzedɔwɔƒea le, gake tsidzadza sesẽa kple tsiɖɔɖɔa megblẽ nu le eŋu o.
The branch office is located in this state, but it was not affected by the heavy rains or flooding.
Kerala: Ƒome 100 ʋu yi ɖatsi Ðasefo bubu siwo le nuto siwo le kpo dzi me la gbɔ hena ɣeyiɣi aɖe.
Kerala: Some 100 families have moved to higher ground and are temporarily staying with other Witnesses.
Afɔku Ŋuti Kpekpeɖeŋunakɔmiti aɖe le ŋku lém ɖe nɔnɔmea ŋu be woakpɔ nu siwo woate ŋu awɔ.
A Disaster Relief Committee is assessing the situation.
Alɔdzedɔwɔƒea le ɖoɖo siwo wowɔ be woatsɔ akpe ɖe ame siwo le nuto siwo me tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le ŋu la dzi kpɔm.
The branch office is coordinating the relief efforts in the affected areas.
Nutome sue dzikpɔlawo kple Dukɔa Me Xɔtuɖaŋu Kple Xɔtudɔ Dzikpɔƒe la me tɔwo le dɔ dzi vevie be yewoanya ale si nɔnɔmea le ahakpe ɖe nɔvi siwo ŋu tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le la ŋu.
Circuit overseers and Local Design/Construction field personnel have been working hard to evaluate and help our affected brothers and sisters.
Wole nuhiahiã veviwo abe tsi nono kple ŋutilãmenuhiahiã bubuwo ene la nam wo, eye wotsɔ Biblia me nyawo hã le akɔ fam na wo hele dzi dem ƒo na wo.
This includes providing material support, such as the distribution of basic supplies like potable water, and spiritual encouragement.
Míele gbe dom ɖa be Yehowa nayi edzi anɔ kple mía nɔvi siwo ŋu tsiɖɔɖɔa gblẽ nu le.
We pray that Jehovah will continue to be with our brothers affected by the flooding.
Míele mɔ kpɔm na ɣeyiɣi si me "ŋutifafa gbogbo " ava xɔ ɖe dzɔdzɔmefɔkuwo teƒe la vevie.
We look forward to the time when natural disasters will be replaced by an "abundance of peace. "
Psalmo 37:11.
Psalm 37:11.

Nuteƒekpɔkpɔ Aɖewo: Amedzrodzeƒe siwo takpekpevalawo dze la dometɔ ɖeka (Four Points by Sheraton Warsaw Mokotów) ƒe tatɔ, si ŋkɔe nye Aƒetɔ Kamil Kaźmierkiewicz la, ŋlɔ bena: "Dɔwɔwɔ kpli mi nɔ bɔbɔe ŋutɔ adzɔ dzi nam ŋutɔ be magaxɔ amedzro siwo nyoa dɔme heɖea nɔnɔme nyuiwo fiana abe miawo ene.

Local Experiences: Mr. Kamil Kaźmierkiewicz, general manager of Four Points by Sheraton Warsaw Mokotów (one of the hotels that accommodated delegates), wrote the following: "Cooperation with you is exemplary I wish I would have more guests who are so kind and positive.
Lɔlɔ̃ sẽŋu kple ɖekawɔwɔ si le mia dome la ɖe dzesi ŋutɔ. . . .
The strong connection and unity between the participants is visible. . . .
Ale si nuwo nɔ ɖoɖo nu etɔxɛe la wɔ dɔ ɖe dzinye ale gbegbe. "
I take my hat off to the perfect logistics of this event. "

Aƒetɔ Kamil Lubański, si nye ʋudaƒe ƒe dɔwɔƒe (KL Team) si xɔ dɔ be woanɔ nɔviwo kum yi takpekpewɔƒea la ƒe tatɔ, hã gblɔ be: "Tso esime míedze dɔwɔwɔ kple Yehowa Ðasefoawo teti ko la, mede dzesii be dɔwɔwɔ kpli wo avivi ŋutɔ.

Mr. Kamil Lubański, owner of KL Team, the company contracted to provide bus transportation, also related: "Right from the start of our working together, I could sense a very good atmosphere and working relationship from Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Woléa fɔ ɖe dɔ ŋu hewɔa nu ɖe ɖoɖo nu ale gbegbe.
They are very involved and professional.
Wodzra ɖo ɖe takpekpe gã sia ŋu hewɔ ɖoɖo ɖe eŋu nyuie ŋutɔ.
This very large event was well planned and prepared.
Míaƒe dɔwɔƒea wɔ dɔ na dɔwɔƒe gãgãwo, siwo dome dziɖuɖudɔwɔƒewo hã le, le wɔna tɔxɛwo wɔɣi le dukɔa ƒe teƒeteƒewo kple Europa dukɔ bubuwo hã me.
Our company has had the privilege of supporting many prestigious and government events that were organized on a national and European level.
Ke hã, mebɔ be nàkpɔ asisi siwo wɔa dzadzraɖo nyuiwo hewɔa nu ɖe ɖoɖo nu nenema gbegbe o.
However, it is rare to find a client that is so logistically and methodically prepared.
Kpuie ko la, nya nyuiwo sɔŋ koe le míaƒe ʋukulawo kple dɔwɔla bubuwo si woagblɔ tso Yehowa Ðasefowo ŋu.
To summarize, our drivers and coordinators only have positive things to say about working with Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Míele mɔ kpɔm vevie be le etsɔme la, míagawɔ dɔ kpli mi ake. "
We hope that in the future we will be able to work together again. "

Invited Branches: Australasia, Britain, Canada, Central Europe, Chile, France, Greece, India, Italy, Korea, Micronesia, Scandinavia, Sri Lanka, Tahiti, Thailand, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey

Nuteƒekpɔkpɔ: Steve Moore, si nye tatɔ kple amegã le dɔwɔƒe si woyɔna be Visit Phoenix, si wɔa ɖoɖo ɖe dzeƒewo ŋu na ame siwo adze amedzrodzeƒewo, modzakaɖeƒewo kple ame siwo ade takpekpewo ŋu le Phoenix ƒe nutoa me la gblɔ be: "Mewɔ dɔ sia ƒe geɖe, gake takpekpe sia ye nye esi ŋu wowɔ ɖoɖo ɖo nyuie wu ɖe sia ɖe si teƒe mekpɔ kpɔ. Dzi dzɔm ŋutɔ be mewɔ dɔ kpli mi.

Local Experience: Steve Moore, the president and CEO of Visit Phoenix, which helps book conventions, hotels, and resorts in the Phoenix area, commented: "[This convention] is the most professionally organized convention I’ve ever had the pleasure of working with in a very long career.
Tsɔ kpe ɖe eŋu la, miedo ŋugbe be yewoadzra bɔlƒoƒea ɖo hafi adzo ame bubuwo mewɔa esia o. "
And on top of that, you promise to clean the stadium before you leave no one else does that. "
